text: So maybe I should not be sampling Christmas Ale the first really hot weekend of the summer. But it is St. Bernardus, why not? Put away after a spring trip to eastern New Mexico, saved until now. The 750 ml bottle gives an amber-brown body and a healthy beige head. An inviting nose, I detect yeasty bread and tropical fruit, maybe a little floral. I taste to get currants, figs, some hard candy sweetness. It finishes dry in the mouth, very little bitterness. Glad I got a try at this. Other Belgians deliver more.

dark dried fruits and caramel with good alcohol. luscious and deep with a morphing finish as it is complex. surprisingly mellowing as is expected by the style but not anticipated in the taste. good winter spice.

Aus der Flasche (2015) 2017-04 getrunken. Ein tolles, durchgereifte Christmas Ale was zur kalten Jahreszeit sehr gut paßt. Ich hatte schon lange dieses Bier nicht mehr im Glas und bin nicht enttäuscht worden von diesen Klassiker. Kaum Süße und eine runde, aber tiefe Malzigkeit. Lecker!
12oz bottle dark brown pour with off white head dark fruit and malt aroma taste is caramel rasin and licorice fairly boozy

Originally rated on 12/27/2008. Nice christmas beer here, it poured a deep brown almost black body with a light thin cap that left some good lace. Aroma and flavors of plum, raisins, bready malts, clove, spices, and some floral notes. Overall a pretty good brew thats worth a try.

Mousse beige importante, couleur brune opaque. Arôme épices, fruit noires, cerises. A la dégustation cest renversant, quel peps! Les épices et les fruits noirs sont dune profondeur, la cerise est bien marquée, on retrouve également le pruneaux. Cest une bière remarquable de Noël, dans la lignée de la Brasserie. Une excellente découverte. 33 Cl Bootlegger Paris
Wow. Jai été chanceux dacheter cette bière par hasard a la LCBO durant les fetes. Je men fais des reserves lan prochain. trop bon!

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy color; Aroma of sweet malt, some yeast, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably plums & apples), caramel, raisons, and cinnamon; Nicely balanced & fairly complex; Really good seasonal brew.

33cl bottle from Sip, Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy dark amber with a lasting, off-white head. Malty and fruity aroma with Belgian yeast, hints of bananas, caramel and mild spices. Medium sweet with classic Belgian flavours and a light bitterness. Well integrated alcohol. Pleasant winter warmer.

01 - Bottle. BB date Sept 2018; Drank Jan 2017 - Deep Reddish-Brown in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Good lacing. Spicy and fruity aroma. Very Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums, dates, banana. Quite vinous. Spicy; Christmas spices, cinnamon, nutmeg. Yeasty; sedimented. Malty; bready malts, caramel, candy sugar, hint of chocolate. Smooth. Good balance. Sweet spicy fruity yeasty malty throughout. Warming alcohol. Enjoyed this. Good Christmas Ale! (2017-01)

Rödbrun, något oklar.
Doft: Syrligt, malt, lite vinig, torkad frukt. 
Smak: Malt, pumpernickel, syrlig, lite coca cola, kryddig (typ kryddpeppar), lite alkohol.
Flaska drucken med ölföreningen. Smak och doft av torkad frukt, marsipan, smörkola, karamell, kolaremmar, äpple. Stor kropp och sötma, rund och len, fruktig, fin beska.
Lovely Christmas beer, looks like coke, smells like cough drop, and tastes of cloves and Christmas in a glass. Hides the alcohol content well but is a mice slow drinker.

Zapach intensywny, słód, suszone owoce, przyprawy, karmel, toffi, marcepan, alkohol. Kolor brązowy, mętne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, przyprawy, karmel, cukier, suszone owoce, śliwki, alkohol. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.
Barwa ciemna, pianę gęsta i obfita. Aromat intensywny, bardzo ciekawy. Przyprawy, karmel, chleb, cytrusy... W smaku trochę słodkie, trochę kwaśne, delikatna goryczka. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.
Bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Bière assez crémeuse aux notes de réglisse.
Heavily carbonated with pronounced longing aftertaste. Yeasty notes as well as aniseed spices. Dark brownish colour with large bubbles. Its tangy, but in a pleasant way.

033 bottle. Pours deep brown, tan fine head, low retention. Aroma is sour-sweet, hints of licorice, candied apples, caramel, lemony notes, toffee, caramel. Taste is full-bodied sweet maltiness, caramel, slight tartness, sugary notes, honey, sweet finish, almost no hops. Alcohol is present, but not overpowering.

Cola colored beer with massive foamy beige head, Cookie dough, rock candy and sweet tea with traces of allspice. Sweet toasty malt, alcohol isnt shy up front, very sweet, dusty, perfumy aftertaste, a bit too sweet for me.
330ml bottle at House of Belgium, Xiamen. Pours red brown with an off white head. Aroma of malt and Belgian yeast. Sweetish finish.

Flaska från 2014, ca 2,5 år gammal lite drygt. Provning med Nerikes Ölsällskap. Mörkbrun, något murken med beiget skum. Söt, maltig doft av råsocker, torkad frukt, pumpernickel. Stor kropp som dock försvinner aningen snabbt. Maltig och söt i smaken med lite rostade toner tillsammans med torkad frukt och bränt socker.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 250 ml from tap at tAntwaerps Bierhuyske. Served in original glass. Complex spice aroma. Cinnamon, cardamom, anise, clove. Black cherry. Dark chocolate. Surprisingly not that malty. Fantastic finish. Soft carbonation, oily texture. What a beer - my first 5 here.
Backlog, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Acheter à tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à dottignies .
Bouteille de 33cl. 
Couleur brune profonde , pas de brillance et de reflet un peu trouble .
Mousse abondante mais redescende assez vite pour laisser un col de mousse plutôt fin.
Au nez : cest le malts caramel qui est bien présent ! Un peu dépice aussi mais tout en douceur.
En bouche : cest assez doux malgré ce quelle affiche !
Très aromatique ! Le malts caramel est bien équilibré donne un goût caramel et sucre progressive. Un peu dépice en fin de bouche .
Carbonnisation bien faite .
Un bonne bière dhiver qui réchauffe et fait du bien.

330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Wine & Beer, Glasgow (£5.00):
Interesting & drinkable but disappointing when compared to the previous St. Bernardus offerings & definitely lacking something. Opening a lot weaker than expected with a light, sweet taste, it didnt seem like a 10% beer. There was good carbonation & the darker fruits were nice but they seemed fleeting & not strong enough. It was a relatively easy beer to drink though with a subtle tang & okay balance but it was a little underwhelming & easily my least favourite St. Bernardus beer thus far.

Pours a rich brown from a bottle, nice off-white head with medium bubbles. Banana nose. Who you calling banana nose? Not so much in the mouth though, turns more caramelly with faint coriander and yeasty spice. Very good beer.

This holdover from Christmas puts with a huge tight head that stays the color is a clear dark leathery topaz sienna color. Spicy yeasty nose some banana ester. Some alcohol heat but balanced with the malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Head disappears somewhat quickly. Not much aroma. Smooth burnt malt flavour. Slight carbonation.

A slightly hazy, dark brown pour with an off-white head. The aroma is fruity with notes of plum and grape. It has a full body with smooth texture and average carbonation. The taste is sweet with a mildly boozy, slightly dry finish.

Ar: Pungent ripe banana; peach, black pepper and clove; some hints of dark caramel. Ap: Deep brown with amber highlights; medium dark tan head with moderate-good retention, settles to a ring of fine bubbles and a thin cap of haze with a few suds. T: Sweet banana up front, mingled with notes of clove and alcohol; moderately sweet with peach, plum, and more banana mid-palate; finish is banana, peach, and fruit leathers, with a low bitterness, slight black pepper, and toasty, rich caramel. P: Medium-full body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: Solid Belgian Christmas ale; there is a robust fruit and spice character, though banana is without a doubt the most prominent; good sweetness and carbonation, and the dry finish keeps it drinkable; alcohol warmth is a bit noticeable, but not terribly of style for a big, winter beer.

12 oz. bottle. Dark fruit and cherry aromas along with a slight sour note and a touch of cream. The color appears to be a dark brown until its put under a bright light where it appears almost a deep rose color which is beautiful. The taste follows from the aroma with cherry, plum, cranberry and apricot along with a very slightly sour woodiness and a bit of Belgian yeastiness. The body is relatively thin for a Christmas beer with this level of fruit and alcohol, but its not watery. And speaking of alcohol, this does *not* seem like a 10% ABV beer (which is dangerous)!  Finishes with light candied sweetness and lasting fruit flavors, as well as a faint earthy hop bitterness. Delicious Belgian Christmas ale!

Bottle 
Aroma-dark fruits, caramel 
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, 
Palate-full body, creamy, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Pours a deep brown with a tan, lingering head. There's a good bit of yeast in this bottle. I swirled and poured it all, so there's a good fruity yeast aroma. This is predominant on the nose. Yeast comes through in the flavor as well. There's a good bitterness that sticks around and a somewhat silky, fizzy mouthfeel. There's slight warming in the lower esophagus but not much. There's a tad of vinous, boozy tang on the tongue, though. A good Christmas Belgian ale. Could have more flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Half of an 11.2 oz. bottle, consumed on Christmas Eve, 2016. A 07 07 19. Cloudy, root beer float-like appearance. Brown with a large amount of frothy, short-lasting, taupe head. Tangy orange aroma. Lemon juice scent. Smells like a Tripel. Cola flavor with spices. Turmeric and cumin as well as licorice. Nutty taste. Lively and frothy in the palate. Medium body, light for the ABV. Overall, decent but does little for me. Another disappointment from St. Bernardus, a brewery the reputation of which far exceeds the enjoyability of its products.

Une claque! Cest une véritable claque prise en découvrant cette St Bernardus Christmas Ale. Et pourtant jy étais préparé, je savais que jallais aborder une bière dexception. Mais lémotion est toujours indescriptible en découvrant ce type de bière que jappellerais bière "cathédrale". "Cathédrale" car à linstar de ces références architecturales à la fois impressionnantes par leurs dimensions, leur assise au sol mais également par leur profil élancé et leur finesse, la St Bernardus Christmas impressionne par son ampleur et son intensité gustative mais également par la finesse de ses arômes et son élégance. "Cathédrale", car à linstar de ces chefs duvres bâtis par lhomme où chaque pierre révèle en elle même de milliers de détails raffinés et élégants, sassemblant dans une parfaite harmonie, la Saint Bernardus Christmas a une complexité gustative exceptionnelle évoluant tout au long de la dégustation dans un parfait équilibre. Déjà, en verre, notre bière est prête à nous amener vers lélévation. Un brun profond, opaque, couplé à une effervescence marquée lui conférant une splendide mousse beige, crémeuse de deux centimètres dépaisseur. Le nez est alors alors un premier pas vers les 7ème ciel avec des arômes à la fois épicés et fruités : cannelle, badiane, cerise, pruneau, poire et abricot sentremêlent pour notre plus grand plaisir. La dégustation vous confère alors des émotions que seuls les grands chefs uvres sont capable de procurer. Le syndrome de Stendhal nest pas loin. Lattaque est pleine et soyeuse sur la cerise, le raisin et la cannelle avec une dimension vineuse certaine. Cest alors lexplosion en bouche, pruneau, chocolat, cerise et date sintègrent à une amertume, très pointue, cisaillant les arômes et très bien soutenue par les 10% Abv. La corpulence est exceptionnelle et lharmonie sans faute. Le final, finira votre élévation par une déclinaison dépices : cannelle, badiane et thym notamment donneront une nouvelle dimension et une multitude de déclinaisons....Un noël tout simplement magique, qui ne demande quà être partagé avec ses proches.

Pours almost like a Champagne once the cork is popped, lots of head retention with a dark color almost like a brown ale color. Also has a haze to it (chill) Taste has lots of dark fruity character mixed with spices and banana from the yeast. Finishes dry, medium sweetness. Light bitterness. Overall I really liked the warming sensation to this beer while drinking it. The alcohol is present but not at the forefront. Definitely a nice winter beer to have on a cold night.

330 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars in Brisbane. Pours dark brown with light tan head. Aroma is malt and subtle cherries. Typical soft Belgian fermentation. Flavours are cherries and dark fruit Really enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Delicious Christmas beer I wasnt able to enjoy until a week after Christmas this year. Big aromas of sweet plums, figs, and sweet bready malt. Very true to the Abbey style. Taste is almost tart which is interesting. I got a ton of fresh cranberry juice and plums. Super bready and sweet, just a classic for the holidays. Awesome as always.

Brun i färgen. Jäst i doft och smak men balanseras upp av malt och lätta julkryddor. Lite tunn hade förväntat mig än mer tryck i smakerna

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dactyls, figs, raisins, caramel, orange, spices in nose. Pours dark brown with beautiful beige creamy and lacy foam. Taste is sweet with lots of dried fruits, caramel, candied fruits, spices. Low bitter finish, average body, no sign of alcohol. Overall very good.

Color marrón oscuro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (estilo espuma de afeitar, buena retención). Carbonatación media. Aroma a caramelo, especias y frutas. Sabor que sigue al aroma, algo más dulce de lo esperado, con ligerísimo amargor final. Indudablemente rica, pero tampoco encuentro qué tiene de especial en referencia a otras belgas de su mismo estilo.

Has a nicely spiced taste with a semi-dry caramel finish. Not sure if it was just stored improperly, but there's a slight metallic taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1/2 pt at six degrees north glasgow
 pours a dark brown with beige head 
 Aroma is dark fruit sultanas prunes etc
 Taste is sweetish malty spice cinnamon clove long spicy finish
 good beer as usual from this brewery
Heerlijk bier met een zeer volle smaak. Te complex om allemaal op te noemen. Een van de beste quads ter wereld.

Piana dość obfita, gruba, mydlana, szybko opadająca do pierzynki. Barwa rubinowa, klarowna. W aromacie kandyzowane morele, rodzynki, melasa, karmel i zioła, ale też trochę starego chmielu. W smaku podobnie, dość słodkie, ale nie zalepiające, sporo kandyzowanych i suszonych owoców, miodu oraz cała masa przypraw. Goryczka nieduża, w posmaku lekko szałwiowo miętowe nutki, może anyż... Wysycenie średnie, treściwe i pełne w odbiorze, ładnie schowane 10% ABV.

Jako piwo świąteczne wypada bardzo dobrze, ale że jest robione na bazie ABT to uważam, że dodatek tych wszystkich przypraw i ziół raczej wpłynął niekorzystnie i piwo smakuje mi mniej od oryginału.
750ml: Pours a dark brown with tan head. Slight cinnamon aroma, clove and caramel. Lovely flavours of molasses, caramel and stewed fruit. Overall a top 3.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is fruit and malt with a hint of sugar, the taste is medium bitterness with a very soft dry finish.

The aroma is Belgium yeast, bread. Pours a copper/brown with mostly diminishing beige head and very good lacing. The taste is sweet then a touch sour. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation fizzy and the finish long. Very good!
24.12.2016 - No. 24 from my advent calender. Resinous dark dried fruits. Thick body with lots of alcohol.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

A: fruity, sweet, hint of sourness like peach.
A: amber clear body, 1 finger white head
T: slighty grainy, bitter slighty sour taste ?
P: médium light body medium low carbonation.

O: good, very drinkable good contrast between sweetness and bitterness/sourness.
Clove and savoury. Full malt. Nice and rich but finishes with anaceed and clove. Not my. Thing at all. Not bad but I cant really drink it.

Beautiful deep copper color with ruby red reflections. Not very good quality head, beer seems to be over carbonated. But still look very good. Aroma is rich, sweet, malty, fruity, dense, very pleasant. Has a notebook of some dehydrated fruits, spices even without a touch of alcohol. Taste is also very rich, full of flavors. Less sweet, but still left your lips a bit sticky. Notes of malt, dark bread, fruits and dry fruits are present. Mouthfeel is a bit disappointing - was expecting thick and dense body - it is not. Whats more - its realy over carbonated. I do not like strong beers to be that much carbonated. Nevertheless, in overall - it is an awesome beer!

330ml bottle [Thanks to St Bartlebierius, OCSO (Ordo Cervisipotorum Strictioris Observantiae) for catering!]. Cloudy chestnut colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Slightly pungent alcoholic aroma, notes of dried fruit, raisin, prune, banana, date, fig. Taste is sweet, slightly sugary, hints of rock sugar, treacle, some alcohol, notes of dried fruit, raisin, apple, hints of fresh red apple, pear sirup (Grafschafter Birnenschmaus). Full body, smooth, soft, silky palate.

Bouteille avec un BB du 06/08/2019. Robe brune très foncée et somme toute claire surmontée dun généreux col de mousse blanchâtre et onctueux. Arômes de sucre candi, gelée de bleuets, tarte aux mûres et fraises, malt caramélisé, nougat et levures belges. En bouche, une foule de petits fruits confits, caramel chaud, mélasse, levures belges. Quelques saveurs dépices sucrées et de cacao, pâtisserie, pruneau, banane. Texture onctueuse/soyeuse, corps moyen à rond. Très bonne.
Flesje gedeeld met familie. Donkerbruin bier met weinig schuim. Fruitig aroma, smaak is caramelachtig met en zoet. Nasmaak is iets hoppig.
Fles gedeeld met Inoven BartvG en JoepvW tijdens tweede kerstdag. Het is een lekker donker bier met wat weinig schuim. Het heeft een lekkere zoete geur en smaak.

Bottle. Dark brown with nice lasting head. High carbonation. Aroma is dominated by plum, brown sugar and some malt. Taste is sweet malt, fruits, bread and yeast. After a couple of seconds the alcohol is noticeabe in the taste. A bitter ending also. Nice. Will have this every christmas.

Piana gruboziarnista, acz zaskakująco trwała. W aromacie czerwone owoce, brzoskwinia, dosłownie dotknięcie przypraw no i niestety, zmywacz do paznokci. W smaku czerwone owoce, jest wytrawnie, nawet nieco kwaskowato, nasycenie bardzo wysokie. Wódczany finisz. Piwo generalnie sprawia niezłe wrażenie, można w nim odnaleźć elementy genialnej dwunastki, z tym, że jest kompletnie nieułożone. Mogłem trochę je przetrzymać w piwnicy.

Bottle from K&S in Bruges. Pours very dark brown with a big frothy cream head. Nice sweet aroma with cristmas cake, plum amd red wine. The taste is rich and vinous with raisin and plum along with caramel and peppery spice. Walming booze and a touch of aniseed. Full mouthfeel. Good stuff.

750 ml bottle purchase at the Hawkesbury LCBO on November 10, 2016. Dark brown, small head. Spicy yeast aroma, notes of malted ripened red fruit. Spicy field berries taste, light sweet notes of barley malt, light sour finish. A quintessential Xmas ale!
SB beställning, flaska. Fin etikett. Komplex arom honung och frukt. Cittus. Vacker färg. Spritsig. Fin konkurrent till champagne. Utsökt. Ingen enighet om champagneutsagan.

Very sweet malty aroma with yeast presence. Dark brownish amber color with a think highly carbonated head. Taste is sweet with fruits, dark malts, some alcohol, bread, light bitter. Fuller body, smooth body, drier finish. Glad we left this out for Santa

0,75l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Pours dark brown to red liquid, medium frothy tan head, Aroma: sweet, ripe bananas, candied orange, apricots, raisins, cherries, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, banana, candied fruits, raisins, warming alcohol, Palate: full body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long banana candied fruits aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, very good.

Nasal geht viel belgische Hefe an den Start. Ein karameliges Malzfundament wurde erfolgreich erschaffen. Spicearomen und Flavours machen auch mit. Besonders der Nachhall ist citrussäuerlich und trocken rotfruchtig. Classic BSA Stuff vom allerfeinsten. Aber leider auch kein Ausreißer der wilden Sorte. 0,75l Bottle aus dem FINESTBELGIANBEER Online Shop. Unter 5 😀. Denke ich hatte ne ganz frische 2016ner Edition. Würd ich gern in ein paar Jährchen nochmal vernaschen. Nur um zu überprüfen ob sich dann die etwas garstig Säure zähmen lassen hat. Und vielleicht wird dann ein unfassbar explosives Spektakel entfacht..?!?!?

Rocky beige head stayed on a murky dark brown lightly effervescent body.
Dark fruit, demerara sugar, malt, spicy aroma.
Full bodied, smooth on the tongue & very slight tickle on the back. Quite dry on the aft.
Dark chocolate, malty, plum, banana, orange, stewed fruit & quite boozy.

Bought from drankdozijn.nl in a 750ml bottle with cork. Appearance: Dark brown beer with a beige head that reduces quite fast. Nose: fruity, banana, malts and some yeast, very pleasant. Taste: banana, warm spices and dark but not black malts. Alcohol is present but not too much. Hops are well balanced, like always with beers from St.Bernardus. This beer has some hints of anise. Otherwise I do not taste too much Christmas in it. Never the less a great beer!

Brune légèrement trouble surmontée dune mousse type champagne, ivoire, qui disparait rapidement pour laisser un collet de quelques millimètres. Nez très riche, très pâtissier, liquoreux avec une bonne dose dalcool. De bons malts chocolat, des céréales chaudes rappelant le bon pain sorti du four et beaucoup de fruit, banane, pêche, abricot, citron, pruneau, mirabelle, mangue, goyave, poire, noix, datte, amande, raisin sec, quelques traces de rose... De bonnes notes dépices, poivre, cannelle et vanille, un côté acidulé très vivifiant avec quelques arômes de balsamique et des parfums dherbes (thym, coriandre, origan...). Sublime sur tous les plans ! En bouche, grosse surprise : bière beaucoup moins sucrée quil ny parait, amertume franche et légère sécheresse, alcool généreux, carbonatation solide. La deuxième gorgée révèle la levure, les céréales et les notes boisées. La troisième est directement sur les liqueurs type mirabelle et prune ainsi que sur les vins pétillants (Champagne, Clairette, Lambrusco etc.)... Les suivantes vont évoluer sur les houblons, très végétaux et assez secs avec une grosse longueur, les notes de terre et de tanin qui rappellent quelques vins du côté de Bordeaux. Le final est excellent, lalcool descend délicatement mais sûrement le long de lsophage, larrière-bouche sarrêtant sur ce côté liqueur, les épices et les herbes ainsi que sur quelques céréales. Bière très complexe qui demande à être apprivoisée en plus dêtre assez surprenante. On retrouve en bouche et avec plaisir quelques notes de balsamique et de Lambic qui rappelle la Bourgogne des Flandres, cest un régal ! Cette bière de Noël nest peut être pas ma favorite dans le genre, mais je dois reconnaître un travail de brassage assez exceptionnel voir génial qui menchante le corps et lesprit. Je ne vois rien à rajouter en ce 24 décembre ! Cest déjà le réveillon... Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Égrève.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Pours clear reddish darkish amber. Aroma is dirty spicy herbal yeast, also candy and almond. Body continues, sweet but still not super heavy. Some fruit, also booze. Palate is sweet and sticky. Very nice.

375ml bottle on a bottle share @Alebrowar Gdynia 
Spices and Belgian yeast, biscuits and dried fruit in aroma. Taste is mid sweet and slick the mouthfeel. Very nicely full, soft carbonation

Nez: Caramel, fruits secs
Bouche: Caramel, zeste dorange, banane, fruits secs, épicée
Une excellente bière de noël

Deep brown body, medium white head. Aroma of dried and ripe banana, candied orange, caramel, yeast, alcohol fusel, light sherry notes. Flavours of banana, caramel, orange, dried fruits, alcohol fusel, light chocolaty notes, light bitter backbone. Long warm caramel and banana finish, slightly dry and bitter. Medium body and carbo. Slightly too boozy, I should try to age it a bit and see what happen.
The delicious beer I age all year to savor during the most wonderful time of the year. Excellent flavor stands on its own or pairs well with desserts.

Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is just lashings of ripe bananas. The flavour starts off as ripe banana and gives way to stone fruits like plums with a cough medicine type aftertaste. Its lovely but its a little bit over carbed for my preference.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - dark brown to black with orange around the edges. Big fluffy head.
Nose - candied orange and candied sugar. Toffee.
Taste - fudge and orange. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy yet tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish. Light booze edge.
Overall - lighter bodied than expected for the ABV.

Bottle. Dark red-brown with big tan head. Aroma of belgian yeast, plum, banana, dades and alcohol. Taste of belgian yeast, bread, spices, raisen. 

God jul!

Dark brown with slight reddish tones. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is fruity, creamy, roasty, with some taffy tones. Tastes bitter and spicy (from the phenols and spices, not hops), tones of nutmeg and clove, all balanced by a malty, but not too sweet undertone. Has some light acidity from the darker malts. As it warmed, it took on more grainy taste and smell. Quite good, maybe too many spices.
Dark brown with a big beige head. Lots of lacing. Fruit, caramel, yeast ans a bit of spice aroma. Somewhat sweet. Alcohold quite present. Nice
Bottle, thanks Kirsten! Dark sugar, spice, plum. Darkest brown, offwhite head. Medium full body, foamy dry, minerals,broad sugars, good drink.

Dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is slightly phenolic, nuts, caramel, some citric spices. Taste is citric spices, a little caramel sweetness, quite sour. Smooth with much additional carbonation. So not so smooth in total. Slightly too sour but very nice.
Flaske 750ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Drukket i hyggelig selskap under Storflaskesesjon på Nerstranda 5 Nov 16. Åpner med smell & røyk. Filmskum. Lett plommearoma. Smaken krydder. Syrlig.

On tap @ piazza Cavour in Como
It was a little bit too cold, but I had appreciated the full body and the taste of this Christmas beer

Tap at Hop Cat, Detroit. Pours dark brown ruby chestnut, off white beige head. Aroma is Belgian esters,plum, fig, toffee, vanilla, burnt sugar, caramel, some Christmas spice notes, a slightly hoppier presence than Im used to in Belgian beers which is not unwelcome. Flavor is fig, dark fruit, toffee, Belgian esters, cinnamon, Christmas spice character. A really solid winter warmer.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Caña en Cerveceria Kraken (Oviedo) Aroma a malta y especias, sabor tipico belga pero aún mas dulce, mucho cuerpo, enorme en su estilo, buenisima!!

Flaska från SB. 2015 vintage drucken med ölföreningen. Stor, massiv kropp, riktigt maltbomb men tyvärr för rå påtaglig mörk sötma. Behöver nog minst 2-3 år till att mogna för här finns massor av kvalité. Gott men för sött.

Hazy brown, airy light beige head. Fruity, malty aroma with light spice and yeast. Has some vinous notes too. Sweet malty flavour, light note of dried fruit and spice, cinnamon, some wood. Warming alcohol, light burn in the finish. Gets rather boozy actually, but still nicely balanced. Not bad.

Look: dark red with beige head
Aroma: malt, spices, some fruits.
Taste: malt, fruits,wood and notes of grass.
Bittersweet aftertaste. Great balance of bitterness-spices-sweetness

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Deep brown body with a thin off-white head. Faint lacing. Aroma of stewed apple, musty attic, pastry, wood and spices. Flavour of crisp apple, brown bread and cherry. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Light fizz. A nice beer but (surprisingly for the ABV) its not quite the complex winter warmer I had in mind.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown with a fading beige bubbly head. Aroma is of caramel, plum, ginger, treacle, dark fruits, raisins, figs. Taste is of dried fruits, biscuit, plum, ginger, hint of cherry, raisins. Light oily mouthfeel, hard carbonation.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown with a thick creamy tanned head. Smell of dark fruits, raisins, ficus, caramel, dark malts, spices and clove. Heavy sweet, fruity dark malts, raisins, caramel, quite spicy, alot of clove abd allspice, delicious stuff. A delight!

Bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with creamy, stable beige head. Clear aroma of malt, fruit, raisins and yeast, with subtle vinous notes. Sweetish flavour of fruit and malt, with estery and hoppy notes and touches of raisins and cinnamon and cloves. Fruity and spicy aftertaste with estery hints. Warming alcohol presence. Good.

Fruit cherry plum raisin aroma, peppery spice. 
Pours a murky brownish amber color with lasting creamy off white head.
Fruity malty flavor of cherry plum, bread, caramel, spicy yeast.
Medium bodied, frothy soft carbonation. Slight alcohol warmth. Sweet spicy finish.
Enjoyable beer. Complex and interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle bought 2 years ago at Costco. Rich aroma with figgy, raisin, and some orange peel notes. Medium sweet with a slight burnt raisin bitterness, but no objectionable burnt toffee flavors. Full flavored with no stickiness or harsh bitterness. Medium spritzy body with an alcoholic warmth as it goes down. Superb winter warmer.
Forventede mere af huset! Sur smag... og ikke nok jul.. Men surheden trækker den ned
Dark. Dark ripe fruit, mild spice, cinnamon, fig, caramalized brown sugars, raisin. Medium bodied. Finish is sweet with light spice and a dark ripe fruit. Delicious.

Donkerbruin bier met robijnrode gloed en beige schuimkraag. Geur: brood, karamel, sinaasappel, kruiden, kaneel, kardemom, wat alcoholisch. Smaak: moutzoetig., karamel, alcoholisch, kruidig, wat sinaasappel en pruim. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Volmondig. Afdronk: licht zoet, warm alcoholisch en een kruidigheid die blijft nazinderen als gember.

750ml bottle from Vinmonopolet Langnes. Shot followed by smoke when opened. Stable layer, spotty lacing, next to clear mahogany body with a ruby shade. Smell of banana and Yuletide porridge. Sweet taste of cinnamon, banana split, and dark dough. Lingering and warming finish. Full bodied. Very nice in smaller amounts (Big bottle session with Elisabeth, Jan Erik, Stefan and Finn, Tromsø 05.11.2016).

Aroma; roasted malts, caramel, syrup, grass, nuts, almond cookies. Look; beige foam, hazy dark caramel body. Taste; roasted malts, brown syrup, caramel, yeast, fruit notes, nut bowl - nice lingering sweet finish. Feel; good body, soft carbonation. Overall; sweet eve drink. Bottle 0,75l. A 0.75 Pours a hazy darl brown colour with medium sized off-white head. Aroma of caramel, cooked dark fruits, spices, including cinnamon and cloves, sour cherry and yeast. Taste of light sweet and roasted malts, caramel-coffee, cocoa, dark fruits and alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fľaa, Brusels v Poechenelleklder. Tmavia hnedá farba, hnedá pena, dlho drala. Vôňa sladová, jemne vanilka, vianočné korenie. Chuť sladká, no zároveň pikantná, v pozadí jemne sladká čokoláda, vanilka, vianočné korenie. Veľmi ľahko a dobre piteľné, aj keď alkohol cítiť.
Tap at Poechenellekelder. Intense bubblegum in both aroma and flavour. Also some alcohol poking through. Does not seem complex nor pleasant enough to me.

Tap at Le Poechenellekelder. <:i>Dark brown color with medium beige head. Light aroma of dark malt, banana, candies, aceton. Taste, dark
malt, acetone, chocolate.

Bottle in Brussels at Poechenelleklder. Pours brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma of raisins, chocolate, vanilla, spices. Taste is sweet, raisins, milk chocolate, cinnamon, lot of different spices.

Bottle.

A- Dried dark fruits, grape juice,

A- Dark red brown color, clear liquid, beige head.

T- Raisins, dates, musty, brandy.

P- Medium body, thin texture, flat carbonation, dry finish.

O- Not impressed. Quite thin and mostly musty old fruit flavors. No spice to speak of. So much more I want out of this.

33cl-fles op de kerstbierentasting bij Mario. Merci! U: Licht wazig bruin met beige schuimkraag. G: Karamel, gedroogd fruit, kruiden en chocolade. S: Zeer zoet met lichte moutbittere hint. Gedroogd fruit, lichte geroosterde hint, chocolade en wat gist. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

330 ml bottle. Deep brown pour with light reddish hue, off white foam. Aroma is very fruity, very spicy, grape, figs, clove and cinnamon. Taste is rich, sweet, fruity, boozy with a long lingering spicy finish. Palate is full bodied with strong carbonation. Tasty.

Bouteille 330ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur acajou foncé opaque, mousse beige foncée à fines bulles laissant une mince dentelle. Arôme de levure belge, pain aux bananes, malt caramélisé. Arôme de levure, malt caramélisé, épices, alcool, mélasse, un peu sucré, côté fruité. Carbonatation très élevée, corps moyen.

- braun-schwarze Farbe mit leichter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- leichte fruchtige Aromen nach Banane, Pflaume und Himbeere, aber auch
 der Alkohol macht sich bereits deutlich bemerkbar
- die Carbonisierung ist mir viel zu hoch
- geschmacklich dann etwas Rumtopf, Zimt, und Nelke
- das prickelnde Mundgefühl durch die hohe Carbonisierung stört mich
 allerdings ungemein
- im Abgang kommt dann noch eine angenehme säuerliche Kirschnote 
 verbunden mit etwas Muskatnuss hinzu
Fazit: Wenn der hohe Kohlensäuregehalt nicht wäre, wäre es ein erstklassiges Weihnachtsbier

Aroma is figs, booze, caramel, toffee, dry, dark fruit, nice. Appearance is brown, light tan head, hazy. Taste is fruity, tons of fig, caramel, toffee, dark fruits, plums, really good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, crisp, fruit and booze aftertaste. Overall, this is great stuff, even better than Abt 12.

Medium beige head with good retention.
Hazy and muddy brown appearance.
Spicy aroma, fruity, caramel (brown sugar).
Very sweet flavour and very spicy (clove, pepper hints), some fruity and malty.
A very spicy beer.

Hyvin tummanruskea olut melko runsaalla, aavistuksen beigeen vivahtavalla vaahdolla, joka jättää reilusti pitsiä. Tuoksussa tummaa hedelmää, ennen kaikkea luumua, sokerista makeutta ja lievää mausteisuutta sekä jollain tapaa viinimäinen yleisfiilis. Maussa joulu on vahvasti esillä, vaikkei tämä mikään maustepommi olekaan. Tumman hedelmäinen, vahvasti neilikkainen, kanelinen ja hieman aniksinen. Loppupuolellaan hieman maltaisen makea ennen kuivempaa ja mausteisempaa, jälleen varsin punaviinimäistä loppuliukua. Aika täyteläinen suutuntuma, sopivasti hiilihappoinen. Todella laadukas jouluolut.

Finally had a chance to taste this on tap in the magic trees christmas in july happening. Darker ale. Neat how it appears as fairly flat but even without co2 there is a tad of cutting effects on the palette. Was expecting another over the top holiday beer but what I got was a milder, more civilized vesion of what was expected. This is a well balanced brew between a typical holiday spiced brew and a good civilized belgian. Yes, finally a holiday brew that I can respect. Right there in the league of good holiday ales like Reclamation Christmas Ale. Look, I dont care for any holiday ales, but this is acceptable.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: A 0.75 l bottle that poured a hazy copper body with medium sized ivory head. Aroma of caramel, cooked dark fruits, spices, including cinnamon and cloves, sour cherry and of course yeast. Flavor was lightly sweet and toasted and lightly roasted malts, caramel-coffee, cocoa, dark fruits, winter spicy (cinnamon, herbal). A little bit alcoholic. Full body with long, sweetish finish, sugary, spicy and also a bit perfumey. A fine Christmas beer.
Dark red/brown color. Dried fruit aromas, spices, oranges, gillyflowers. Dried fruits, oranges, caramel, yeast and spices. Something off in the taste/finish. Not really sure what. A bit too sweet.
St. Bernardus Christmas Ale - uzupełnienie ocen piw pitych przed używaniem ratebeer.

Una birra veramente particolare che mi ha dato limmediata impressione dei profumi e dei sentori del Natale. Un immediato amaro di luppolo che cede quasi subito ad un intermezzo di malto e caramello con un finale dolce con decisi aromi di coriandolo e cannella. Schiuma abbondante di colore rosa, alcol forte e deciso a 10 abv come è giusto che sia per una birra natalizia. 
Un rara opera darte brassicola. Per veri intenditori.

Dark cola brown with a dense tan head of very tiny bubbles. Aroma is rich cola notes, and taste is the same, with slight cherry funk on a strong dark base. Cant believe Ive had it so many times, and am just rating it now. VGF #2, she made a funny face

Had this one stewing for over a year. Finally. Racked it open. Pours a rosy brown with lees cloud. Thinner head that breaks down rather fast. Nose of brown sugar, malts and prunes. Similar taste of carmel malts, dried fruits, booze and mild yeast. A little thinner on the palate than I expected but a very nice beer.

Bottle 330ml. Thx JSP
Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of sugar, spices, belgian yeast. Taste is of sugar, spices, roasted malt, belgian yeast. Palate: Full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Good, tasty, strong. Not overdone. Nice yeast indeed.
750ml bottle. Dark mahogany body with a medium head. Plums, dried fruit, spices, syrup, candid sugar, some earthy notes. ABV pretty much not noticable.

drunk in beergeek bar around xmas. pours dark brown with a tan head, thick lacing. deep aroma of dark fruits, spices, caramel. tastes creamy and rich, with plums, apple, toffee, cinnamon, candied orange. real tangy yeast flavour to finish. totally great. just my type of boozy fruity burnt toffee ale
Dimmig brun öl med inslag av rött. Stort beige skum. Dofter av malt, torkad frukt, kryddighet och jäst. Samma återkommer i smaken.
Pours dark brown with creamy head. Aroma is raisin, caramel, some sourness, light grass. Taste follows and is quite complex - some sweetness, raisin, spices. Super good beer!

La St Bernardus Christmas Ale est la petite dernière de la brasserie Saint Bernardus. Dans le style des fameuses "quadruples" d'abbaye, cette bière exceptionnelle utilise la même souche de levure depuis 1946. Rivalisant de complexité avec la non moins célèbre St Bernardus 12, elle a de plus été finement épicée afin de constituer actuellement l'une des meilleures bières de noël ! 
Ainsi, cette bière belge se présente dans une robe brune intense, surplombée par une magnifique mousse colorée, persistante et généreuse. Le nez propose lui une très belle complexité aromatique, entre notes de raisins, de caramel et d'épices. En bouche, cette complexité s'intensifie encore un peu plus avec une belle douceur ainsi que des saveurs de fruits confits et un final bien soutenu par l'alcool. 
Cette magnifique St Bernardus Christmas Ale est une superbe bière de noël, qui égale bien des bières en termes de complexité aromatique et gustative. Le plus intéressant étant surement de gouter la St Bernardus 12 pour se forger son propre avis !

Aroma: Dark fruits, caramel brown sugar and and berries.
Pours a dark rich brown amber with a creamy beige head.
Taste is delicious and delightful with sweet malts and dark fruit and toffee caramel and bright carbonation and a little alcohol and a lot of complexity.
Very warming and satisfying!

F: big, off-white, average lasting.
C: dark brown to black, opaque, dark red against the light.
A: fruity, apple, pears, overripe prunes, molasses, malty, yeast, light spice.
T: malty, alcohol warming, molasses, sweet vinous tones, prunes, cherries, apples, light spices in the background, cinnamon, star anise, hint of mint, candy sugar, full complex body, good carbonation, great drinkability, interesting winter BSA worth to try, 0,33l bottle from Beer Temple in Brussels.

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, gingerbread.
Appearance: Brown, hazy, tan 2-finger head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, light spicy-gingerbread, very complex.
Palate: Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, long sweet finish.
Overall: Very well balanced, very tasty, great example of belgian "christmas" beers.

pours dark mahogany with a giant frothy and creamy light beige head. sticky lacing. spicy and fruity toffee caramel - very grapey and particularly lean/svelt maltiness for its abv; red berry-plenty cranberries, but also dried fruits - raisins, golden ones too; very spicy - lots of cloves, mint and cinnamon, red and purple matter, red phénols - bubblegum; astringent grape seeds, slightly harsh booze, some sweetness - treacle and demerara. bright carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet, warming woodsy-spicy finish. a very christmas-ey offering. quite enjoyed with the missus!

330ml bottle. Clear dark chestnut color. Medium size, thick brown head, stays. Sweet, prunes, raisins, Belgian yeast, bit of dirty cloth in aroma. Belgian yeast, metallic, prunes and hint of gingerbread in taste. Sweet prunes and bit woody in aftertaste. Nice mellow gingerbread in late late aftertaste. Crisp carbonation. No hints of alcohol. Very drinkable brew.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Malt, sweet, fruity / Malt, dulce, afrutado.
Aroma: Candy (apple), dried apricot, malts. Appearance: brown, amber, red glow, little yeast, medium lace. Taste: dried apricot, malts, candy, nice balance.

Pullo @ Uba & Humal, Tallinna. Kaatuu trappistipikariin mahonginruskeana ja muhkealla, sihisevällä, noin kolmen sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on runsaasti tummaa ja kuivattua hedelmää, sokerista makeutta ja belgihiivan mausteisuutta. Hennommin on makeaa marjaisuutta ja vanilijaa. Maussa marjainen makeus ottaa vallan, loppumaussa taas kuivatut hedelmät ja makea päärynäisyys kampeaa pinnalle. Mausteitakin on, mutta ne ovat vähän taka-alalla. Maltaisuus tuntuu hieman makean puoleisena tuoden mukaansa alkoholin poltetta. Suutuntuma on yllättäen vain keskitäyteläisen puolella, alkoholi tuo hieman napakkuutta tuntumaan. Hyvä ja tasapainoinen belgiale, mutta suutuntuma olisi voinut olla vielä hieman tuhdimpi.

Pours a clear dark reddish brown with a small offwhite head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of spices, dark fruits and alcohol. Classic belgian quad. Taste is lightly sweet and boozy with nice raisin and fig flavors. Floral alcohol. Spices. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is creamy. Not too much hot alcohol overall, on par with the other world class belgian quads. Overall a really nice quadrupel, I think I will never grow tired of the classic quads.
Bottle. Mahogany body with a light khaki head. Prunes, fig, earth and mineral in the aroma. More pudding and Christmas pie and fig in the taste. Medium body.
Dark amber with off white head - Dark malt and fruity aroma - Dark sweet malt with fruty tones - Dark sweet malt finish - Well hidden alcohol and tastes good
Aroma: Candy (apple), dried apricot, malts Appearance: Brown, amber , red glow, little yeast, medium lace Taste: Dried apricot, malts, candy, nice balance
Een donkerbruin bier met een rijke, volle smaak met een vettig mondgevoel. Specerijen, karamel, rijp fruit in de smaak. Hartverwarmend in de winter.
Mooi donker bier maar kleine schuimkraag. Smaak is opzich goed maar niks uitzonderlijks.

Ambra scuro con schiuma non esistente. Aroma etilico e caramelloso. Al palato è ben sostenuta da una vivace carbonazione, dolce ma con una vena secca, note speziate leggere. Una birra di natale molto semplice ma non per questo immeritevole di un bel voto.

Bottle. Dark red with a huge head. Pine Christmas notes with dark fruit. Spiced red winter Flemish style. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At home bottle shared by Maakun. We have a gusher. Dark brown with fluffy off-white head. Gumball coating, Christmas, pine tree resin, spices, yeast, cardboard. Sweet, with some sour. Body is medium. Carbo is over medium.

Bottle shared. Gusher. Fizzy beige head and dark brown pour. Quite some spices, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dried orange peel, Christmas cake, banana bread, brown sugar. Very sweet and light bitter finish. Over medium bodied with slick feel. Pretty good, I wonder where the gushing came from as there arent really any infected notes.

I am not normally one for Christmas ales, they normally seem like a good excuse to add some masking spices to a second rate ale and make saleable, but St. Bernardus is an exception. Thoroughly enjoyable and without the sickly sweetness of many exceptionally strong ales. This is a well deserved excellent merry christmas ale. I can see why it is sold in small bottles, but reckon I could manage a 500cc one for an even more merry Christmas.

330ml bottle. Dark brown, cloudy, wirh a good off white head that stayed to the bottom of the glass. Aroma is yeast, alcohol, fruit and spices. Taste is bready, fruity, spicy, warming goodness. Excellent

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark brown, medium size tanned head, good lacing. Dried fruits aroma with caramelized sugar, booze, dark bread and bitter orange. Medium carbonated, alcohol-sweet and silky mouthfeel. Raisins and dark dried fruit in the taste, fruit cake, yeast, herbs, clove, bitter orange and banana. There are several flavors and the alcohol notes are always present and warming.
What luxury! What pleasure could enjoy Christmas with a beer like this. Actually, the brewery St. Bernardus beers is capable of great quality to fully enjoy the festivities.

Clear, red-brown ale with a thick foamy head. Spicy, fruity, slightly yeasty aroma. Lively on the tongue. Fruit is ever so slightly sour in the taste and theres a bit of a bready quality to it as well. It doesnt taste as strong as the ABV, and its rich and fruity. Dangerous but perfect for a seasonal winter beer.

Bottle at home. Dark brown colour, foamy beige head. Sweet, roasted malty nose and taste, caramel, spices, liquorice, anise, dried fruits, pear, alcoholic warmth, even vinous/glühwein. Nicely winter-ish. Finish is sweet and spicy, lingers nicely. Lively carbonation, good body. Not exactly my style, but well executed.
La cerveza es brutal. Sabor magnífico y especiado. Casi mejor que la 12 si es que es posible.
Bottle 33 cl, pours a deep Brown colour with a beige head, Sweet aroma, caramel, medium Sweet taste

75cl. bottle at home (and at a bar a couple of days ago). Pours a deep red colour with a large foamy off-white head. Aroma of fruit and spices. Taste is of malt, caramel, spices and lots of fruity flavours. Full body and lively and high carbonation. Long caramel and fruit finish along with alcohol. Pretty good and sweet...but for some reason not as sweet as the one I had a bar a couple of days ago. Perhaps brewed different years.

Bottle at home - Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: caramel and candy brown sugar domination. Caramel malt and spicy notes as anise and licorice. High alcohol feeling. Taste: full body with caramel malt and caramel brown sugar. Really sweet domination and sweet candied fruits. Anise and licorice notes. Good attenuation. Robust belgian ale. Aftertaste: caramel and alcohol finish. Candied fruits.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A sparkling clear dark black-brown beer to brown red at the bottom of my chalice glass ; medium beige head ; medium retention. Roast, toast, spice (clove), prune, pear, herb, alcohol, acid note. Light to medium sweet, light to medium dry bitter ; light warming background. Medium good body, medium texture and average carbonation, spicy warming lasting finish, light dry. Overall, a pleasant belgian strong ale ; powerful, but rough around the edges ; lack of elegance.
Bottle at home. Malty, toast, caramel, banana, raisins and christmasy spice. Lovely winter warmer.

Deep dark mahogany color with huge beige head. Sweet aroma, malty, yeasty, spicy, some esters, apple and pear. Light to medium body, rich carbonation. Taste follows the aroma, apple, pear, esters, yeast, dark fruits, almonds, spices and sweet malts are very present, with a smooth finish.

Large bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Costco. Happy New Year. Opaque brown, thick frothy head. Aroma of prune, molasses, spice, faint metal. Sweet, smooth, very little alcohol. Initial bright sweetness gives way to a long, bitter herbal spice finish. Great.
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Brown colour with beige head. MAlt, caramel aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, fruity, slightly soapy and metallic taste. Medium to full body.
Good beer at the holidays. Hearty. Dark brown, tan head. Great flavor with hint of spice, but don't think it's Brewed with any. Dried fruit, raisins in profile.

Keg in Belgium. Hazy deep brown with a shallow creamy head. Floral, molasses, brown sugar, nuts. Medium to highly sweet with a vivid carbonation that prevents its from being cloying and makes a drier end.

750 ml bottle into signature chalice; best before 6/29/2019. Pours lightly hazy very dark reddish brown color with a 1 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big raisin, plum, apricot, fig, cherry, pear, apple, coriander, pepper, clove, light banana, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, apricot, fig, cherry, pear, apple, coriander, pepper, clove, light banana, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Large amount of yeast/coriander spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark fruits, coriander, clove, pepper, banana, toasted biscuit, brown sugar, brown bread, nuttiness, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/yeast spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Good amount of dryness from carbonation and yeast spiciness. Medium-high carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, moderately creamy/bready, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding Belgian strong dark ale! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on for 10%. A highly enjoyable offering.
Unclear black beer with a white head, medium carbonation.Taste is fruity, raisins, herbs, caramel, medium sweetnes and some good slcohol

Bouteille: Cloudy, deep ruby-amber coloured, very stable creamy off-white head; rather "unsweet" port-vinous and caramelly nose, several dried fruits - as expected - included, delicate traces of wood as well; moderate to solid sweet and also bitter flavour, full bodied, what else; lingering fruity-woody and caramelly finish. Complex and well balanced

75 bottle from LCBO. %10 alc./vol. Pours an opaque brown colour with two finger of lasting head. Aroma of cherries, plums, and dark fruits. Taste matches the aroma with some Belgian yeast notes and finishes dry and hoppy. Lively carbonation.

I started buying and holding for 12 months before enjoying. This is my 3rd(4th) year doing so. It ages well. Good lacing and down to a small head after 15 mins in glass. Sweet yeasty candy nose with a long finish. Dark Amber appearance but with a nice clarity to it. Always pleased with this ale. Merry Christmas!

Pours a dark reddish brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of candi sugar, dried cherries, and caramel. Flavors were full-on sugary estery cherry cough drop magic. Mouthfeel was ultra velvet, almost creamy/foamy. Well-carbonated (came from a 750ml bottle under some high pressure). Reasonably dry finish. Alcohol barely noticeable. Really good!
75 cl systembolaget. En riktig goding som dracks till årets julbord. Kul med nya belgiska bekantskaper.

L:
-pours a cloudy brown with ruby tinges and a big,quickly dissipating,foamy,offwhite head
S:
-plums,raisins,figs,spices,fruitcake,van the nose plus caramel and herbs
F:
-high carbonation
-medium to full body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
Very good Christmas Ale of the fruity variety.However theres quite a few better Belgian ones (Delirium Noel,Nice Chouffe,Kasteel Winter)

L: pours a dark burgundy, with a huge beige head of foam. 
S: a big bright aroma of Belgian yeast and packed with dark fruit. Like a Christmas fruitcake, very appetising. 
T: doesnt quite live up to the nose, but follows it flavour-wise. Drinks a bit more like a triple to me, bright yeast esters, noticeable alcohol, fruity notes. 
F: the mouthfeel is medium-full, very creamy and spritzy at the same time. 
O: it doesnt match the Abt, but made for a great bottle with Christmas lunch.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours chestnut brown with big beige head. Aroma: caramel, butterscotch, banana, red fruits. Taste: high sweetness with low to medium bitterness. Notes of banana and allspice. Texture is oily. Carbobation is lively.
Aroma a alcohol, hierbas. Color marrón, espuma poco abundante. Sabor a caramelo, lúpulo, ligero toque a frutos rojos.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is dark brown colored and has a large cream colored head, with nice carbonation.
The aroma is fruity and yeasty with tones of freshly baked bread and holiday spices like cinnamon and anice, but in the background also tones of dried fruits and raisins. 
The taste is full bodied and medium sweetness with fruity notes of raisins and toffee, which is fastly taken away by the rich carbonation which changes it into a nice hop bitterness with spices and pepper. 
The finish is warming and with hints of cacao and spices. 
Very nicely done, and the first christmas ale which is not extremely sweet. I enjoyed it very much.

Smells like an ale with a very sweet overtone and a boozy smell.

Pours a dark amber/brown colour which hardly lets light pass through. Head very heavy at the beginning and remains to the last drop. Remnants of yeast can be seen at the bottom of the glass.

Taste is similar to the Abt 12 but VERY sweet. Slight hints of spice.

Good amount of carbonation. Very little aftertaste.

Overall I was happy with this beer. Although it is VERY sweet, Im thinking that cellaring will take care of some of the sweetness.

MB
The Beer Bearon

Bottle. Hazy deep amber color with a thin frothy off-white head. Aroma of raisin, caramel, yeast, spices and notes of glue. Sweet and sour taste with a medium bitter finish. Medium to full body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
0,75l fles kerst @ nikos. Roodbruin met een crème kraag. Geur is kruidig kaneel en kersen smaak redelijk zoet en plakkend zoethout een kaneel ook kersen. Aardig maar wel erg zoet
750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy brown with off white head. Fruit, dried fruit, syrup, brown sugar and spices. Semi sweet with low to medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
This is the first St. Bernardus beer I've had, and I am an instant fan. This is one of the best beers I have ever had.

dark brown pour, off white head. Nose is ripe stone fruit and Belgian yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is leather, more ripe stone fruit, deep malt profile. Finish is a bittersweet swirl, fruit and some muted spice.
Dark brown with a light beige head. Fruity aroma, with a hint of spices. Thick with more taste of spices. Good one.

Given to me as a gift which is very fitting for a Christmas beer. Very dark and incredibly boozy. Having with dinner so tastes are getting mixed up but its a nice strong beer if it is cold outside. I still prefer the normal offerings from the brewery thoigh. Thick head and lots of lace, thick as all hell

Merry Christmas! Pours a purple & reddish brown, greyish head. Aroma is raisin, sweet malt, prune, light booze, caramel. Flavor is light sweet malt, caramel, dark fruits, yeast, nutmeg & spices. Medium body (light for size of beer), super active massaging carb. Nice.

Woow. The beer looks delicious. The color is a dark ruby red. There is a little cloudiness in the beer. The beer pours quite a lot of rough off white foam. All the foam collapses and none remains to cover the beer. I dont recognize this from this type of beer. Besides this, the beer has a perfect score when it comes to looks. The smell is good, but not very strong. I can clearly smell the alcohol. This results in a nutty bitterness. There is in a far away distance a tiny aroma of chloride, only sensible when you take a very deep sniff. It isnt disturbing at all. There is also a tiny savory smell, which is very nice. It smells like a typical Belgian ale, but with a little twist. The taste of the beer is nice. I can clearly taste alcohol. I also smell a nutty bitterness, which was also present in the smell. There also is a herbal spicy taste, which is very nice with the nutty alcohol flavor. Besides this there is a fruity flavor (red fruits?). This fruitiness is also present in the smell. The beer has a nice carboxylation. It may be a bit to tingly, a more creamy beer would suit the flavors a little more.

750mL LCBO: dark, brown beer with true opacity. Small beinge fizzy head that dissipates rapidly. No lace and lively carbonation. Nose is ripe fruit, warming alcohol notes and dark malt. Taste is dominated by the sweetness of raisins, plums, and figs, but backed up by a black cherry tartness with some solid malts. Complex, yet balanced. Slightly bitter. Superbly crafted ale for the holidays.

Flaska systembolaget. Brundisig kulör med stort smutsvitt skum. Kryddig doft med mosiga äpple och torkad frukt. Söt smak åt sirapshållet med äppelmos, jäst, hö och örter. Fint balanserad från söt inledning till en halvtorr avslutning med viss beska

750ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Two finger tan head. Dark brown body. Aroma is mostly sugar, dark fruits and spice. Some alcohol present as well. Mostly sweet on the tongue with a slightly bitter, fruity finish.

33cl bottle from 2013 shared with a friend. Hazy dark brown with a small slightly off-white head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Caramel, raisins, ripe dark fruits, chocolate, malts and spices. Riped quite well!

Deep amber to red with a medium-thick tan head - great colour. Light but pleasent cherry aroma with fruit spice and raspberry. Fruit loaf malts, orange zest, cherry and fruit spice. Quite complex. Velvet mouthfeel and adequate carbonation. Hides abv well.

11.2 oz bottle. Aroma is dark fruit, sherry, wet dog, cola. Pours muddy brown with orange highlights and a large long lasting beige head with excellent retention. Taste is savory, grainy, alcohol providing warmth, lightly tart. Nice beer.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours ruby reddish dark brown with a small frothy beige head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slight malty, slightly fruity and tiny spicy with dark bread, toasted cereal, puréed semi-sweet apples, red pears, marzipan, moist soil, sweet liquorice candy, orange zest and hints of bread spices and alcohol.Taste is slightly sweet, tiny sour, slightly malty, slightly fruity and tiny spicy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly velvety, tiny dry, tiny tart, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and tiny sour with dark bread, caramel, toasted cereal, spiced up apple jam, marzipan, moist soil, orange zest and hints of alcohol. Balanced and tasty. Not overly sweet which is nice. Tiny hot but a few years in the "cellar" have dulled the boozy edge.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with an off white head that fades quickly. Aroma is sweet with hints of caramel, brown sugar and alcohol. The taste is bittersweet with Co2 clearly present. The aftertaste has warmness of alcohol.

33cl bottle. Dark ruby pour, with a tall tan-coloured head. Smells of dried fruit (figs, prunes, raisins), toasted dark sugar, chocolate, spices. The taste is very rich and complex, with strong notes of cherries and cherry liquor, followed by caramelized apples, faint cinnamon, red wine and rye bread. An excellent winter warmer, warm, sweet and spicy aftertaste, medium to full bodied and lively mouthfeel due to the high carbonation.

33cl shared bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Body is clear deep amber brown, head is small, beige, fizzy medium bubbles, mostly diminishing, fair lacing. Nose is wine-ish, dried fruits, flavor is red wine, spices, dark berries, dried fruits, light roasted malt. Heavy sweet, light bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bittersweet, light but longer lasting salty umami, medium alcohol warmth. Medium body, dry sticky texture, fizzy carbonation. Not quite easy, wine-ish dessert beer, interesting but not that good, at least not my style.

24-12-2015 Delft

Uniek! Wat een lekkere, bijzondere smaak. Enorm veel koolzuur. Schuimkraag verdwijnt wel snel. Veel suiker gebruikt en dat komt ook in de smaak naar voren. Je moet er van houden maar smaakt enorm zoet en neigt zelfs naar zuurstok/suikerspin. Met name de bijzondere, verassende smaak maakt hem zo goed.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 30th July 2018, poured into a Chimay goblet glass. It poured a dark brown colour with a two finger creamy puffy beige head that dissipated slowly to a nice half finger puffy cap that gives nice curtain like lacing. Aromas are of nice dark fruit cherry, plum, prunes and raisin with hints of apple, banana and spice pepper. Taste is much like the aromas, as theres candied sugar, apricot, cherry, fig, plum and hints of banana. Caramel and toffee comes out as it warms. The alcohol is there but does not affect the taste and is slightly stronger when warm. Creamy, medium bodied with mid to high carbonation. Overall not quite Abt 12 but it is still a great beer from this Trappist brewery that I would buy again next year.

Head goes away quite quickly. Dark brown colour. Raisins, cinnamon and flowers in the aroma. Some sweet caramel, spices at first. Some bread and roasted coffee beans. Liqeury aftertaste. Very well balanced, medium bodied, medium carbonated beer which is enjoyable at the christmas table.
0.33l bottle. Hazy dark brown body, thin off-white head. Aroma and taste of cocoa, chocolate, orange zest, candi sugar and nutmeg. Very smooth and the alcohol is well hidden. Awesome beer.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown beer with a big, light brownish head on top. Aroma is spicey, some cinnamon, Belgian fruity yeast and some woody touches. Flavor is sweet, slighty herbal and has this typical Christmas beer aftertaste, sweet cinnamon and allspice with some anise or something. Was really looking forward to try this beer, turned to be a bit of a disappointment eventually. Well made though, but nothing too special here. Just decent.

Kran. Piwo o barwie ciemno miedzianej wpadającej w brąz. Piana nikła, szybko opadająca. W aromacie głównie suszone owoce, trochę słodowości. W smaku akcenty karmelowe, słodowe, piernikowe, suszone owoce i belgijskie drożdże. Piwo wyjątkowo lekkie jak na swoje parametry z doskonale ukrytym alkoholem. Bardzo rozgrzewające, idealne na zimowy wieczór. Wysycenie średnie w kierunku niskiego.

Piwo czerwono-brązowe, nieprzejrzyste. Ładna piana. Niestety szybko się redukuje niemal do zera. W aromacie suszone owoce. m.in: rodzynki, śliwki, figi, karmel i przyprawy. Tak samo w smaku. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, wysycenie średnie. Fajne świąteczne piwo.

Pours deep dark amber with thick tan head. Nose is candi. Aromas are toasted malts, caramel, red fruits, nutty notes. Average carbonation, full body. Long sweet carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, banana, dried fruit, bread, hops and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, banana and dried fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Those dark Belgian beers with loads of spices are always amazing. Super enjoyable Christmas ale, something everyone can enjoy.

750ml bottle. Pours a huge bubbly beige head and has a cloudy murky brownish appearance. Very thick, sticky lacing. Aromas of yeast, spices, toasty malts, dark fruits. Flavours of dried type fruits (raisins, plums) has hints of molasses, yeast, barley malts. Good balance of sweetness and bitterness. Smooth and slick mouthfeel. Alcohol is nicely hidden, cannot tell this is a 10% abv beer.

Raisin, dates, and all spice on the nose. Honey and earthy notes intensify as it gets closer to room temperature.. Strong alcohol content is warming but very smooth. No contest, the best winter warmer Ive ever tired.
Zeker niet gek. Een lichte bananen geur. Toch prefereer ik als "Christmas Ale", de Engelse originelen.

Brown colour, creamy, off white head that fades to a ring and lace. SMell of dark fruits, candied fruits, spices(cinnamon, cloves, cardamom).Medium body, grat carbonation, sweet palate. Taste of "polvorones", candied fruits, anise, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, nutmeg... Very complex. And great.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Mooi donker bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag die heel snel wegebt. Geuren van pruimen, rozijnen, drop, beetje anijs. Maar het mooiste van dit bier is de afdronk. Lekker warm met subtiele smaken van peperkoek, kruidnagel, beetje vanille en drop (anijs). Absolute topper.

Butelka. Barwa ciemno bursztynowa, mętna. Pian kremowa wysoka, szybko opadająca. Aromat suszonych owoców w szczególności moreli, kandyzowany cukier. W smaku podobnie. Doszukiwałem się chyba na siłę skórki od chleba. Ciężko ją dostrzec w aromacie jak i w smaku. Alkohol doskonale ukryty. Goryczka średnia, niezalegająca podobnie można scharakteryzować wysycenie. Mam wrażenie lekkie wodnistości. Z całym szacunkiem ale daleko mu do Abt 12 lub Rochefort10.
Bottle at home, 18th November 15. Pours dark, nice head, carbonation is high to start with. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, spice. Taste is dark fruit, prunes, raisins, caramel, banana. Really good

Such a great tripel. Reminds me of Rochefort 10 and Westmalle. The 10% ABV doesn't hurt either. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small bottle. Dark brown with a red glow. Tall to medium head. A bit weak aroma with dried berries and some caramelly malts. Fizzy mouthfeel. Taste has cherry stones and dried berries. I like that its not too syrupy for the style, yet at the same time the fizziness makes it a bit harsh. Finish has a warm alcoholic glow. Fruity aftertaste. I like it more than the Abt 12 but neither of them is that great.
Bottle. Deep, dark brown. A nice large head. Aroma was fruit cake. Taste was fruit cake and Christmas spice.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Review from notes. Dark ruby color with beige head. Aroma is yeasty and alcoholic. Taste is sweet, full of yeasty esters with dried fruits but also a slight fermentation note. Body is highly effervescent, acidic and quite light. Not really my kind of beer.

Pours clean deep amber colour with a hauge frothy light-beige head, good retention and foamy lacing. Belgian Ale yeast smell with spices, hops and some hints of dark fruits. The taste has some sourness from the cherries, mild spices and the Belgian Ale yeast. Some dark notes lingers. Goes down quite easy and all very well-balanced.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown with a thick off white head. Aroma of yeast, dark fruits, raisin, spices, cherry. Flavor of rich dark malts, peppery spices, dark fruits, cherry, lemon, nutmeg, Belgian yeast. Very drinkable even at 10%. A delightful beer to enjoy during the holidays. 
8/4/8/4/16 (4.0/5)

Tap at bulldog ne. Ruby with medium white head. Dark fruit, yeast, and alcohol nose. Taste is perfect . Very reminiscent of the abt 12. Sweet and yeast balance, dark fruit, alcohol well hidden. Full body. Amazing finish. Great beer. Merry Christmas to me.

750ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut (7:4:7:3:13=3.4
Sweet fruity aroma, nice esters Palate light and a bit too fizzy. Fruity, but nice. Perfume.
Rerate: 750ml bottle (?, Tallinn) BB2015
Sweet apple. Soft malts. Not saying the booze level, but clearly quite hot.

BB 2019: brown beer, small head. Fruity nose, malty notes, sugary tones, dark fruit, yeast notes. Flavor is dark fruit, slight sweetness, dark malt, perfume. Dry and malty finish, red fruit. Fizzy mouthfeel. Nice, but fizzy.  BB 2015 Fizzy pour, brown beer. Fruity nose, malt, oxidation emptiness, because of the age. Flavor, again, fruity, soft malt, dark fruit. Finishes with dry notes, fruity, malt. Fizzier than the fresh one, what gives.
0.33 l bottle at Pivkan Beer Fest in Zagreb, Croatia. Brown with ochre tint, small head. Cherry, wine and dry fruits aroma. Medium body. Sweet, brandy like structure. Spicy, but to light.

Brunatne, prawie nieprzejrzyste piwo o obfitej pianie, która redukuje się do mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat owocowy, skórki pomarańczy, mandarynek, korzenny, lekko przyprawowy. W smaku bardzo ułożone, owocowe w belgijskim stylu i jakby dodatkowo pomarańcze,, lekkie przyprawy, bardzo mi zasmakowało. Goryczka dość wysoka, przyjemna, krótka. Ogólnie bardzo treściwe i ułożone belgijskie piwo w najwyższej formie, jeden z moich faworytów.

Dark brown to black colored, medium tan creamy head, good lasting. Aroma is sugary, spices, quite fruity, chocolate and roasted malt with Belgian yeasty notes and some alcohol. Taste is medium+ sweet caramel and brewing sugar, fruity, spices, Belgian yeast, some chocolate and bit roasted, boozy with low warmth. Full- bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
Meget sødlig næsten helt ubehageligt. Ellers en typisk belgisk øl, mest pga gærsmagen.

Rossa molto scura, quasi nera, con riflessi color rubino, schiuma beige poco persistente.
Aroma fruttato molto vario: banana candita, datteri, uva, ciliegia; leggera cannella, chiodi di garofano, note vinose e di frutta fermentata.
Al palato prevalgono banana candita e ciliegia, chiodi di garofano; sul finale si affaccia una timida nota erbacea ed oleosa che accompagna un piacevole tepore etilico misto a piccante.
Corpo pieno, ben carbonata, texture oleosa.

Bottle, pours brown with a beige head. Very spicy aroma with nutmeg and clove, sugary, dark fruits. Sweet taste with caramel, spices, dark bread, dates, raisins, cherries, banana. Creamy texture, lots of carbonation, medium body. Warming but not boozy.

St. Bernardus Christmas Ale is one of those rare seasonal releases that beer hounds stay consistently excited about. This year, I became one of those hounds. It pours marvelously. Red-brown body - surprisingly heady and effervescent for a big beer. Fruit and candy-like aromas. Bread, toffee, plum,raisin, fig, and brown sugar in the taste profile. Full yet lively feel - very easy drinking for a ten percenter. Looking forward to aging some of this. I hope to see this around for many Christmases to come.

Passed this up for years, figuring it would always be there. Well, its time! Also passed up a fresh small bottle for this dusty (year-?) old 75cL with cork and cage. Nose complex candyish malt with some fruit, yeast, gonna be sticky, surprised at no booze fumes for this size. Pours deep, dark blood red with a large and fizzy tan head, hint of leg. Medium body, sharp and lightly crisp in the mouth, heat builds with time but does not burn, heft despite the medium body but its all super digestible, so no biggy. Touches of sweet linger longer than the overall dryness.  Dried fruit, figs and dates and raisins and cherry, red berry, minerally, dark malt with light earth and deep sticky toffee. Late grape, but its strong, very nice plum, light but buzzing phenolics layered on top. Heavy clove, heavy spice.  Higher-order alcohols are wonderful here, spinning and playing in the stratosphere but interacting and enhancing those elements below. A true, unbestable winter warmer -- smooth, complex, and gorgeous (and an easy way to a hangover, if youre not careful). [2015.12.08: 3.9]

Pours a dark beige head with malt, cinnamon and ginger bread aromas. Dark brown body. Warm in mouth with tastes of buttered toasts and balanced roasted malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, Beergeek Praha. Creamy tan head dissipated fairly quickly, nice pattern clinging to tulip glass. Dark, opaque appearance, nice body (neither too much nor too little), alcohol smell is not overwhelming. Good feel on the tongue, but something is missing for me...perhaps I am a bit spoiled by other Belgian beers I have tried recently. Overall a very enjoyable beer as an aperitif, but not for a long night of drinking...

Bottle. Pours dark ruby-brown with thick light tan head and substantial lacing. Plum and raisin aromas. Plum and raisin upfront with some alcohol. Mouthcoating, long finish with some pleasant alcohol warmth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark clear color with a foam layer. Sweetish, ambery smell. The taste is quite alcoholic with a typical Belgian overcarbonation and a sweet licorice part that ends in a strong aftertaste.

Pours deep copper with a light brown head. Nose is a rich mixture of brown sugar, candy, nutmeg, and Belgian yeast. Flavor is a burst of the above with plenty of coriander and a bit of bread to go with it. alcohol is well hidden. the finish is short and very sticky. very tasty and probably the best Christmas beer Ive had.

The nose is dry with a caramel malt influence and notes of sticky dates. It has a deep, fruit-cake flavor with hints of boozy rum about it. A winter warmer indeed. A dry finish with a hint of bitterness and long woody flavor and some banana. The carbonation is lively. Its a good one for sharing but Im not sure Id buy more than one.
Tap. Dark brown cloudy pour, moderate tan head. Aroma of banana bread, clove, raisin. Sweet banana, roasty, nutmeg, cinnamon, sweet finish. Thick.
Lekker kruidig kerstbier. Helemaal niets mis mee. Alleen al het etiket is een goede reden om dit bier elk jaar weer te kopen.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark brown pour with a large off white head. Nose is of sweet dark fruits, cinnamon, clove and molasses. Flavors of Christmas spices, caramel, figs, plum, toffee and brown sugar. Nicely balanced. Rich palate. Alcohol is well hidden.

Caña en el kraken 05..12..2015. Color oscuro con poca espuma beige. Éramos y sabores maltosos algo tostados con bastantes toques de caramelos tostados y especias. Cuerpo medio algo pastoso y con espuma. Buena.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2015 Brun med høyt skum. Aroma av sukker, rosiner, banan, krydder og malt. Smaken er tørket frukt, sukker, krydder og noe banan. Søt, før den blir mildt sur i ettersmaken.

Sinterklaas, Kerstman... wat maakt het allemaal uit... het zijn beide ouwe lullen in een rood/wit pak... mooie gelegenheid om de St. Bernardus Christmas te openen zeg ik zo...... schenkt mooi donker bruin/rood met fijne geel/witte kraag. Aroma van erg veel overrijp fruit en winterse kruiden. Voordeel van zpn 75 cl fles is wel dat hij mooi de tijd krijgt om op te warmen, en ik moet zeggen des te warmer des te beter begint hij te smaken.... of komt het door al de acohol in het bier.... smaken zijn redelijk/stevig zoet, matig bitter, mout, caramel, veel donker fruit, rozijn/pruim/vijg. veel kruiden kaneel, anijs, noten, aards, lichte wijntoets/iets van brandy. zacht en romig van textuur, volle body, goede carbo, erg lekker spul... en absoluut lekker laten opwarmen eer je begint ...

Tomada de grifo en Cerveceria Kraken.
Pasa por ser una de las mejores cervezas navideñas y no defrauda.

Espuma blanca, cerrada.
Aromas dulces y especiados.
Color marron oscuro, Cuerpo medio
Potente desde el primer momento, pero no alcoholica, camufla sus 10º entre afrutados, dulces y especias, peligrosamente facil de beber.

Muy recomendable
From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Watching Son of Anarchy 2x03. Superb in all aspects. The perfect christmas beer. Amazing nose, tasty, warming, great body.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 06.08.19. Bardzo bujna piana, opadajaca do korzuszka i tak pozostajaca. Samo piwo ciemne, miedziano brazowe. Aromaty przede wszystkim ciemnych owocow, suszonych, sliwek, fig, daktyli, rodzynek - taki misz masz przesympatyczny. Do tego nieco przyprawowosci (gozdziki, cos piernikowego), nieco karmelu, nieco melasy, nieco bananow. W smaku ewidentnie slodkie i mam wrazenie, ze dochodzi intensywna nuta imbiru i cynamonu, ktorych nie ma tak jednoznacznie w aromacie. W ustach czuc bardzo wysokie wysycenie. konsystencja dosc ciezka, gesta, nieco syropowa, sporo pelni. Alkohol bardzo ladnie ukryty, to 10% glownie jako grzanie w przelyku. Klasa piwo. Zwlaszcza, ze przyprawowosc czy swiatecznosc nie jest przesadzona, to jednak nadal po prostu bardzo solidny ciemny belg czy tam quad. Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Une bière très intéressante, riche.
Le nez est pas mal : beaucoup (trop) de levure, un fond caramel avec des notes épicées (anis).
La bouche révèle bien plus : présence en alcool modérée par une belle attaque caramel/levure/épices. Dans ces dernières, on retrouve lanis mais aussi un fond cannelle.
On perçoit des notes fruitées de pamplemousse, banane.
Assez complexe mine de rien mais manque déquilibre : la levure est bien trop présente et perturbe toute la dimension épicée qui tire sur lecoeurant et biaise la buvabilité.

750ml bottle. Dark burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are dried fruits, bread, banana, roasted cereals, molasses, licorice and spices with herbal notes. Full body, good carbonation, sticky texture.

0.33 l bottle from belgiuminabox, bottled in August 2014. Clear, very dark red with a huge, foamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Fruity-malty aroma of raisins, prunes, brown sugar, caramel and some port. Sweetish, fruity-malty, a little spicy taste of ripe banana, raisins, caramel, clove and port, followed by a slightly sourish, yeasty, lightly bitter finish. Medium to full body, highly effervescent mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. Unfortunately overcarbonated, the aroma is pleasant but a bit subdued, but the taste really makes up for it. Rather complex, not as sweet as expected, a little sourish as well, great!

33cl bottle, shared on 22-Nov-2015, and poured into a stemmed tulip glass. Clear dark ale with a thick tan coloured head which quickly dissipates. Aroma if liquorice, brown sugar and caramel.
