Full body and light to medium carbonation. Lots of dark fruits, malt, caramel, sugar and yeast. Sweet finish.

Dark cola brown that bubbles consistently leaving some fruity head that never disappears. Banana, cherry, rum, licorice, dried fruits. Vanilla and almond aftertaste. Nice and enjoyable especially on a cold night.
Shared bottle at DSJT at Cardinal 08.11.15. Hazy brown amber. Persistent beige head. Aroma of hops, spices, Jägermeister and vanilla. Similar taste, with malt. Quite well-balanced. High carbonation.

Bottle from Tanakaya. First Christmas beer of the season. Pours a brown with a 2 finger soapy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Caramel, candy sugar, chocolate toasted bananas and fennel on the nose. Medium body with average to slightly soft carbonation. Silky and sweet on the palate. Super complex; each sip reveals something new. Hides the alcohol masterfully...really drinks like a 6.5% beer. Finish is sweet and slightly syrupy with bananas. A little too sweet for me, but solid.

Rating #1376 - 12.12.2014 - Sample from @HorizonKyle. Clear, dark brown pour, bubbly tan head that fades to a ring in my St. Ambroise chalice. Aroma is toffee,black licorice, toasted fennel. Taste is alcohol, toffee malts, licorice, fennel - a nice mix of sweet, and tart. Beautiful Christmas ale.
Pours dark Amber with off white lacing. Smell is dark fruit. Taste is mild cherry, dried fruit and malt. Very smooth and warming after taste. Very enjoyable.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Red with "fizzy" sounding tan head. Raspberry, cherry, caramel and Belgian yeast. Sweet, sticky, cloying, earth, dry and spicy finish. Overall: average and over-carbonated.

Draft at uber. I was inspired by Crow to finally start plugging the gaps in my "classic Belgian" beer list. Clear ruby-tinged mahogany pour. Small head, some lacing. Aroma is quite fruity, in that Belgian cherry redvine kind of way. Caramel, some spice (clove mainly). Tastes rather sweet, almost syrupy but dries out enough in the end to remain drinkable. Full body, velvety syrupy texture. Overall: missing that extra something to draw me in for a repeat.
Bottle from G&B; Hammel. Pours dark brown with a good tan head. Aroma and taste is sweet malt, dark dried fruits, toffee, brown sugar, yeast. Lively carbonation. Sweet warning finish.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Dark brown. Light tan head. Candy sugar nose. Some ester and alcohol. Sweet. Full body. Very lively carbonation. Candy sugar and banana flavour. Fruit. Slight hint of cherry. Brown sugar. Very, very good!

From 330ml. Pours dark brown with a ridiculous head, seriously, took like five minutes to get this into the glass waiting for the thick pillowy head to subside. The nose features a nice whiff of spice and malt, while the complex flavors are all over the place - cinnamon, coriander, clove, raisins, caramel and banana. The warming alcohol makes this a good choice for cold winter nights (with or without a fire). Outstanding.
Bottle from The Real Ale Store, Newark. Deep Ruby colour with a tan head. Spicy fruit and slight yeast aroma. Taste light fruity sweet.

Flaska inköpt förra året. Intensiva dofter av dadlar. Kan även urskilja aromer av fruktkaka och russin. Värmande och fyllig munkänsla. De 10% är som bortblåsta från bryggeriets karta. Söt men inte översöt. Fruktig utan överdrift.

dark mahogany colour, large, creamy beige-ish head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of dried figs, plum, maybe some cherries, too, raisin notes, herbs, hints of anise, gingerbread and candy sugar; taste is the same, though a little bit masked by a bit too agressive carbonation; would be perfect with a bit less CO2

Bottle from Koht. BB 06.08.19. Pours a dark coppery brown colour with a ruby glare; the heads big-bubbled, drops fast and leaves a thin scattered layer. The aroma... ooh, nice... where to begin... plummy, caramelly, slightly spicy but not specifically christmasy (which I like), very pleasant candy- or bubblegum-like notes. The flavours similar; the booze starts to creep forward only after a while. Warming. This is multilayered stuff. Very active carbonation, at first it feels almost aggressive even, but it mellows later on and helps cut through the somewhat sticky palate. And to be honest, as the carbonation flattens, the whole thing kinda dies. Other than that, its an excellent brew.

0,33L bottle (from Koht). Pours dark brown with brownish beige head. The head stays. Aroma is spices, dark fruits, sweetness, malt. Flavor is sweet, caramel, burnt sugar, alcohol, spices, malt. Finish is spices and alcohol. Overall: good, but too boozy and feels a bit underwhelming compared to many BSA-s.
(5) Average at best. Wonderful aroma and taste. A good beer. Had a wonderful idea of what power this beer packs. !

Dark mahogany pour, thin fizzy tan head. Warm sweet aroma, caramel, dark fruit, spicy, ginger, coriander and clove. Taste follows with a sweet heavy, slightly syrupy body. Some warming alcohol comes through. Love it.
Fruity, yeasty, jam, earthy, warming, copper colour, red tints, big off-white head, big sweetness, lightly bitter, warming.
Pours brown with a off white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit, malts and sugar. Taste is caramel, fruit, alcohol and toffee.

The aroma is limited to a few spicy notes of indeterminate nature. It is a very sweet ale that tastes pleasantly of candy, in a way that only Belgians can do sweet beer. The sweetness is retained by heavy fruit notes as fig, plum, prune and raisin. There can also be found flavors of cinnamon, clove and anise flavor slightly. Hop bitterness is high not to find. The alcohol in this ale is high and it felt on warming certain taste. If you like strong Belgian ale is this a real good bet.

First sip was "hey, not bad". Second one was "ok, it tastes alcohol and it will be difficult to finish my glass".
Its a Belgian Ale after all, and it isnt my type. 
Its strong, and have a complex taste (beside alcohol), but I cant figure what am I drinking and the final product isnt good fory my tastes.
Christmas aroma ;) rich and malty brew. Candy sugar. Heavily spiced. Belgian strong ale trending towards barley wine.

From NOTES.

A: Sweet dark caramel malts, dark fruits, Belgian yeast, clove, coriander, pepper, other spices, candi sugar, booze.

A: Dark hazel with very little head. Nice lacing.

T: STUNNING! A sweet, bready, malt bomb with spices galore. Absolutely nothing I would change or add, it is perfectly balanced. ABV is completely hidden.

P: ull bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a warming, sweet, and lightly spicy finish.

O: My favorite Christmas beer. Another fantastic beer from St. Bernardus, deep and complex. A great beer to sip over a long evening.

Large bottle that had been aged 4 or 5 years in my refrigerator. Metallic aroma didnt promise much. The flavor was worlds better with some great sweetness and fruits in the mid-palate. Dark brown, lots of head, great pop and distance from the cork, some alcohol obvious. But overall very good.
Bottle in Brussels. Nice brown body with white head. Nose floral, bananas and sweet. Taste of caramel, fruits, bananas and bitter. Nice finish.

(on Tap) Pours a medium brown with almost no head. Very smooth almost to the point of seeming watered down. It hides the alcohol content well. I wish it were a little thicker and the flavor lasted longer. The smooth syrupy flavor disappears too quickly to really enjoy it. Hard to savor it when it doesnt hang around for long. Its not bad but it could be better. I like Belgian style ales but this isnt one of my favorites.

Aromat: gruszka, brzoskwiania i jabłko oraz delikatna przyprawowość.
Wygląd: barwa ciemnozłota, piana potężna, ładnie zdobi szkło.
Smak: sporo słodkich owoców - głównie gruszki i brzoskwinie - oraz wyraźne przyprawy, goryczka średnia, alkohol delikatnie grzeje w przełyku.
Tekstura: średnio pełne, spore wysycenie.
Ogólne wrażenie: bardzo smaczne piwo, świetny aromat i smak, alkohol jest praktycznie niewyczuwalny, co w połączeniu z dużym nagazowaniem oraz średnią teksturą, sprawia że piwo jest pijlane.

Marrón oscura, de espuma media, blanquecina. Aroma de caramelo, licórico y algo especiado. En boca buen cuerpo y gas medio, y un sabor moderadamente dulce con evidente base acaramelada y luego una serue de elementos más complejo con frutos secos, hongos... Alcohol presente sin exagerar. Sabrosa, pero no entre las mejores Bernardus.

Bottle. Aroma is very nice, doughy and yeasty, rich and fruity too, plums, booze, caramel, toffee, all sorts of good stuff. Marzipan. Taste is rich, delicious, fruity and yeasty. Cant see much difference from the regular 12, but I havent had that for a while. Although maybe this is a bit fruitier. Imagined it would be spicier.

Dark brown with frothy head. A: red pepper, boozy cherry aroma, generic plum/chocolate mix. T: christmas cake, red peppers, mixed with regular sb12. D: peppery, slightly boozy development with anise hints at the end. Aftertaste: bit peppery as well. I like the sb12 better, it has a deep sweet sensation that im missing here.

Clear brown colour, white head. Aroma of banana, candy, caramel, banana candy, those yellow banana sweets. Sweet flavour, caramel, light bitter, apple and banana. Sweet finish, apple brandy, strong banana sweets.(from 33cL bottle @ home)
Houterig . In de nasmaak metalig . wel bekende volmondige smaak . Rook ervaar ik ook in de mond .

Bottle. Pours brown, a little hazy with minimal tan head. In aroma very complex, malty, caramel and toast, bread, dried fruits. In taste strong malty base, sweet, caramel, dired fruits with low mint finish. Medium bitter, full bodied, soft carbonation, alcohol present in good way. Very good quad.

750 ml bottle. I cant remember where I got this...
Cloudy dark red colour with a small off-white head. 
Fruity, cherry, tart, sourish and mild metal notes in the aroma. Lambic-ky.
The flavour is sweetness, syrup, malt, alcohol and mild dry fruits. 
The lambic notes in the aroma makes this quite fresh. The flavour could have more of those elements.
Sweet earthy and fruity aromas come from this deep red and hazy brew with a beige head. Full bodied malty sweet crisp with a ton of tiny carb bubbles. This is an abbey and well done.

Mørk brunorange tåkete med høyt beige skum. Mørke frukter, svisker, gjær og karamell. Mest fruktig søtsmak, markert sviske, toast og noe brent karamellburterhet. Krydderier. Fyldig. Litt salt i avslutningen. Mye kullsyre

Bottle. Overflowed a bit when I opened it. Pours a hazy darker brown color with a moderate off-white head on there. Nose has some hints of bread to it as well as some candied figs. Taste is slightly sweet and has some dark fruits coming through. OK, but not really my sort of thing.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 Bottle. Dark brown beer. Spicy aroma with plums, dark fruits. Taste is dark fruits, prunes, bready malts, caramel, quite boozy. Good but there are better alternatives.

This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a hazy brown color with a one finger sustaining white foamy head that concaves a bit but holds its own for a good two minutes before dissipating ever so lightly. 
The smell had a sweet to lightly spiced combination of cinnamon and ginger running into a sweet biscuity/bready goodness. Subtle hints of cocoa allocate nicely in and around my nose.
The taste took all of those previously mentioned flavors to combine and flavor a sweet bready aftertaste leading into a semi - wet finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sipping quality running about. Carbonation seems to run smooth and semi-dry.
Overall, as a Belgian Strong Ale, its awesome to me its still awesome. Would love to have again for Christmas!

The aroma is crisp maybe of caramel. The appearance is a nice amber with a thick tan head. The taste is a bit strong of alcohol, malty, caramel. Heavy to drink, probably can only do one of these in a night. Overall not that bad, but could have been better.

Piana pojawi?a si? na u?amek sekundy i od razu znikn??a, nie pozostawi?a po sobie ?ladu, nawet nie pobrudzi?a szk?a. Na powierzchni ta?czy?y tylko drobne b?belki.
Bukiet to wyra?ne go?dziki, pomara?cza, przyprawy nieod??cznie kojarz?ce si? z zim?.
Smak mocno wytrawny, ?liwki i wszystkie atrybuty aromatu, które przywodz? na my?l grzaniec, jest tak?e masywny i ci??ki, no i oczywi?cie alkohol, który niesamowicie rozgrzewa.
Mimo swojej mocy (10% Alk.), alkohol w piwie jest bardzo dobrze schowany. St. Bernardus Christmas Ale czaruje goryczk?, która jest sucha, wytrawna, "pestkowa".
Mo?na odnie?? wra?enie, ?e to piwo jest "t?uste", tre?ciwe, a jednocze?nie ?atwe do picia, wysycenie wi?cej ni? ?rednie. 
Bardzo polecam na zimowe wieczory, przy kominku z dobr? ksi??k?.

Pours murky dark brown with a nice pillow beige top. Aroma is a slight spice of nutmeg and cinnamon and sweet caramel malt. Taste is much the same, spice is not overpowering just a nice accent to a well balanced winter warmer.

330ml bottle from Belgium in a Box - Chunky dark chestnut brown body, with a lasting two finger beige head, very good lacing. Rich, full aroma of banana bread, toffee, dark fruits, and some floral notes. Medium body, velvety, smooth. Fantastic banana bread flavor, nutmeg, spice, caramel, some very light floral and grassy notes. Love it.

red brown pour dense foam that vanishes. Aroma cola, cherries, barley, sour tang. Tastes brown sugar, cola, pears, orange blossoms astringent like a ginger ale. Light fast drinking slight creamy effervescent.

What a treat. Great Christmas beer, but I can obviously see this bee delicious at any time, especially in winter. Similar to ABT12, there are resemblances, but this is its own beer through in through with the butterscotch being the star.

750 ml bottle had this many times but never rated it. Apperance is muddy brown with plenty of head and good retention. Aroma is cinnamon, fruit cake, and rasin bread. Taste is clove, nutmeg, cinnamon, followed by raisins some malty sweetness and a touch of light bitterness. This is a classic, my favourite Christmas beer.

0,75 Dark amber coloured. Unclear. Light brown head. Fruits, light raisin, spice (cloves and cinnamon) in the nose. Flavour of dried fruits, alcohol, spice, ligth cocoa and liqourice. Full bodied. Marcipanny alcoholdense end. Exellent beer. Gonna age nicely also

Bottle at home while cooking some carbonnade a la flamande. It pours a cloudy brown color with a large, fizzy head that disappears quickly. The aroma is very sweet with baked bread, over ripe plums, apples, raisins and some cinnamon/baking spices. The flavor is very full bodied and rich with more intense fruity flavors of plum, raisin, dates, fig and nice baking spice notes. The alcohol is noticeable, but not oppressive. The finish is sweet with more baking spice especially in the aftertaste. Warming and comforting, just like the Abt 12.

Cant say this one is much about christmas - light "christmasy spices". Otherwise, very nice Belgian strong ale. Intense dried fruitiness, ripe fruits. Lovely malt orchestra in background, caramel, light roast, candy, bit yeast. Bit warming alco kick in finish
 Bit overcarbonated for my like, but anyways - very nice

A respectable strong Belgian ale, more outwardly flavorful and less subtle than the St B 8 that I like so much. Worth having when it is available. 2014 edition sampled in DFebruary 2015. Perhaps I should have waited a year.
330 ml bottle. Cloudy brownish colour. Small beige head. Big alcohol nose. Good job, nicely done.

750 shared with a work buddy... 2014 bottling.. Pours a deep walnut but still shows good clarity, khaki head sticks around forever with nice lacing. Toasty with a bit of spice cake essence.. Not as rich as some of the other Quads but still very respectable.. Very high carbonation IMO, pretty burpy.. With warmth, the spices bloom a little more than I appreciate.. Nothing wrong with it, I just prefer the Abt 12 better.
750ml to stem. Amber brown with huge frothy offwhite head. A: dark fruit, malt, spice. T: zesty fruit, spice. Perfect balance. Outstanding.

[Bottle] Hazy dark brown pour with a large pillowy head. Nose is of sweet dark fruits, cinnamon, clove and molasses. Flavors include Christmas spices, caramel, fruitcake, figs, plum, toffee and brown sugar. Nicely balanced. Rich palate. Alcohol is well hidden. Good stuff.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Dark caramel with tan foamy/mountainous head; seafoam lacing. Aroma is sugary sweet with light dark ripe fruit, toffee and Belgian yeast. Taste is very sweet with warm from the alcohol. Really nice creamy mouthfeel. Nice winter warmer.

Cerveza típica navideña, sabor intenso con leves toques de caramelo, no se nota su fuerte graduación, para mi gusto se hace pesada ,es una cerveza para compartir.Me sigo quedando con la bernardus normal

11 oz bottle in tulip glass. 
Banana bread powerful, clove, vanilla pudding, carmel sugars and fig with hints of other fruits on the nose. Ruby-brown, clear, toasty head, steady head, little-no lacing. Flavor is complex malty-grainy base. heavy sweetness, low bitter, cleaner flavor than aroma profile. Quite alcohol forward. Low spiciness compared to aroma, no trace of clove with subtle earthiness/vegetal flavor thats very nice. Drinks easy, to style, for a 10% brew. Overall not disappointed at all. Not as complex as one expects from a St Bernardus ale. Will drink again, enjoyable, would pair wonderfully with roast meats, and pulled/chopped pork bbq.
Sensing clove, ginger, caramel, and roasted malts. Dark brown medium bodied carbonated with a fizzy feel. Definitely hits the high mark on a Christmas ale and highly recommended.

Pours hazy reddish brown with a massive white head. Aromas of yeasty apple, ginger, plum, cinnamon, raisin, biscuit and brown sugar. Flavors are clove, ginger, plum, chocolate, coffee, and yeasty, bready tones. Finishes with chocolate and ginger. Peppery mouthfeel. Delicious!

(St. Bernardus Christmas Ale) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a tulip. ABV 10%
Mahogany brown colour on the body, big tan head, thin but with good retention, leaving spots of lacing on the glass.
Aroma of caramel, spices, candy sugar, light dark fruits.
Tastes really good, a bit sweet but nothing extreme, dark fruits, light vanilla, caramel, some alcohol, wine notes.
Medium body with good carbonation. 
Pretty good, definitely a winter warmer.

Amazing holiday beer. One bomber. Two people. Celebrate in front of a fire. So warming, rich. An amazing Belgian beer from an amazing brewery. Highly recommended. A treat once a year. 

- pixels sent via Beer Buddy on iOS
Classic xmas beer. Dark brown. Dark fruit, booze, sherry in the aroma. Creamy big mouthfeel. Lots of spices and fruits dancing around. Heavy but delicious.

A rich, burnt, dried fruit of a beer that is perfect for Christmas. Smells of sweet sherry & tastes of caramel cake.

Rated by BrewTom

A dark reddish brown coloured beer with a fan coloured, frothy head. A heady alcohol led aroma, with ripened forest fruits, spice and treacle. Strangely light bodied for its strength and a fizzy mouthfeel. A mouth filling taste, boozy, cherry and plum ripened fruit, treacle and dark caramel flavours bring on a mild clove spice. The finish is long, fizzy and full flavoured.

@ Havregatan 150124. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, fruity and caramely with spicy and alcoholic notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet and fruity with spicy notes and some alcohol warmth.

Started cold and went to warm, out of a 750. Had several separate flavors at first. Fig is a definite flavor through out the whole experience. As it warmed up everything started to come together. Smooth, flavorful, delicious. Tongue feel still had some fizz to it which took away the full effect of smoothness.. Overall do it again. Thanks

Pretty cool burgundy pour w/ a huge foamy tan head that leaves spotty lacing. The aroma is a little boozy, a touch sour, & full of malt. The taste is well balanced w/ some caramel malts standing out. My only knock would be that it finishes a bit thin for such a strong beer. However, its tasty & highly drinkable at 10%. Nice!
33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is brown. High carbonation. High sweetness. Aroma is banana, spices, malt, coffee.

Bottle. Blackish brown beer with a strong slightly off white head. The aroma is spiced and vinous, the flavour is spiced with a vinous roastedness, with yeasty hints. Overall a nice strong Belgian ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vertical of 2010-2013 shared by raveskdr. Thanks Chris!

Copper brown body with a broken beige head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, caramel malt, well water, mineral, raisins. Smooth flavor, showing some signs of age (10, 11). Medium bodied with soft carbonation on all vintages, with the most recent perhaps a bit more vibrant. Lots of flavor. Slightly sweet, with subtle spice and a touch of brown sugar. Tasty.

A vertical of 2010, 11, 12, and 13, many thanks Chris. Pours a clear plum brown with active foamy light beige head that leaves spongy lacing. Aroma is complex - candi sugar, dark fruits, yeast spice character and sweet brown bread. Flavor is same - this beer is clearly meant to be aged. The 10 is deliciously round and mellowed out, and the 13 is surprisingly hot. Buy now, drink after at least 2 years.

A opaque brown body with a tan head that had good retention and nice lace. Aroma was a mix of dried fruits, cloves brown sugar and toasted malts. Flavor had a nice level of sweetness and dove to it. Nice cloves and sugar. Dark fruits and a light tannin in the finish. Nice mouth feel alcohol was well hidden. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Orange red pour, finger foam, not too much spice, just right, clear, hop finish slight creamy feel. Possibly my favorite Christmas ale of all.

Bottle from systembolaget. Pours her with a medium beige head. Nose is sweet with dates, brown sugar and malts. Taste is equally sweet and complex. Palate is thin and oily, very drinkable with a big fizz. Overall a good beer, nice for a Christmas dinner.

(750ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours a lightly hazed pale cola color with a moderate frothy off-white head that recedes to a ring leaving little lace. Aroma toffee, caramel malt sweetness, canned cherries, red plum, banana esters, herbal, dark bread. Palate very sweet, caramel and brown sugar, candied red fruit, bready, yeast towards the finish where it gets a bit drier with soft spice, herbal bitterness, slightly chalky. A little alcohol heat. Medium full in the mouth with fairly prickly effervescent carb. A pretty tasty Belgian strong, maybe a bit sweet on the start but moderated later in the sip. Just doesnt blow my mind.

750ml 2014 years vintage brown corked and caged bottle, label featuring a jolly monk sporting a santa hat, poured into Tulip glass. Appearance is opaque dark brown with a huge beige airy frothy head, that settled fast leaving some lacing on the glass. Aroma of dried figs, cherries, dates, pears and black currants. Flavours of dried figs, caramel, dates, pears, prunes, black currants, spices and dark bread. Taste is medium-light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, smooth texture and lively carbonation. St. Bernardus Christmas Ale is deep and complex, a delicious beer.
Aroma is sweet with dark fruits. Complex. Fruit, caramel. Nice Christmas ale.

On tap @ De Baron, Eindhoven. 25cl sample. The aroma has caramel, raisin, nuts, spice. Dark brown coloured with a medium-big, off-white head. The taste is moderate sweet, has caramel, plums, nuts, mainly. Moderate carbonation. Bit sticky finish. Good in its style.

Corked and caged bomber - dark brown with a tan head. Has a fresh aroma of dark fruits and a taste of baked apples and nutmeg. The alcohol is definitely stealthy in this one. Gets even better as it warms. Good brew.
Second time Ive had this, keep forgetting this is not like the Abt 12. All in all a great beer.

Good quad ale. Appearance is a rich black color, very similar to the abt 12. Good head on the beer with ruch lacing and carbonation. Aroma on this bottle was a bit flatter than I hoped- full of dark fruits, maybe some cherry,but nothing exceptional. Like wise the taste has the standard belgian strong ale feel with the dark fruit. Palate is exceptional with only minimal burn, and quite creamy.
Overall a very good ale, but missing any stand out qualities for me and therefore not exceptional rating.

This is great. Pours slightly murky brown with lots of I key head and lacing. Nose is sweet malty wih some carrot cake. Flavours are dark fruit, some graham cracker, some syrup and some cheerios. Taste medium sweet med/light bitter. Full somewhat sticky body with med carbonation.
Une très belle bière de noël, puissante, riche, opulente tout en restant équilibrée et digeste. Un régal
Bottle from Belgian Beer Shop, Leuven. Dark brown, creamy white foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of plums, raisins, brown sugar, spices. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Well balanced. Very good.

Pours a dark brown color with a nice off white head. When you pour a St. Bernardus, it even has a different look coming out of the bottle. Belgian yeast, sour and spices aroma. Good sweetness, dark fruit and spices tastes. Unique feel and flavors in the mouth. Awesome beer

big malt aroma, prune and plum fruits. some cardboard aromatics. no hop aroma, big belgian yeast aromas, some cinammon raisin. clovey yeast flavor with a effervescent carbonation allows a spiciness fly forward, with a malty raisin flavor. alcohol is present but not overwhelming. solid stuff for the holidays.

0,33l bottle. Pours dark brown wit medium, shortlasting off-white head. Aroma of cloves, cinammon, almonds and gluewein. Sweet, fruity flavour. Full body, sticky texture, lively carbonation and long finish.

Bottle 330ml. Hazy dark brown with slowly diminishing big beige head. Sweetish aroma, fruity (cherry, plum, pear), tart, some spiciness and graininess. Very sweet flavor with lots of cherry and plum, quite spicy and yeasty, a bit buttery, creamy, very sweet finish with light sourness. The alcohol is well hidden for a 10% abv. Lively carbonation, medium to full-bodied. Too sweet but well brewed.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Nose: chocolate malt
Color: dark brown
Head: good 1", dies down fast with no to minimal laces
Feel: mouth feel is frothy and light
Taste: chocolate malt, fruity with little spice (cinnamon), little hops. Overall complex but not for hop-heads!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky mahogany colour with large cream-coloured head. Aroma is big raisin, toffee, brown sugar, Christmas spices and dark fruit. Flavour is very raisiny with some dark tree fruits, candy sugar, toffee and some nice Christmas spices. Lively carbonation. Quite nice.
On tap. Was served too cold - not revealing much of aroma or taste. Dark brown. Could make out notes of caramel, raisins and nuts. Very smooth in the mouth. Felt very similar to an Abt 12. Good one!

Gedronken vanuit een 33ccl fles. Een mooi krachtig winterbier, wat ook goed staat bij het kerstdiner. De kruiden komen goed naar voren en dit is echt geniet bier ten top. Laat er ook wat bewaren om te kijken of de smaak veranderd.

Bottle at home. Poured into a red wine glass. Handsome dark brown beer. Nose is sweet and sour. Taste initiallly sweet raisin, caramel, and other sweet malts. Spices like cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg clearly detectable. Finish is not too long unfortunately. A very nice winter beer.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours dark brown with tan head. 
Aroma spice, caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, sweetsour. 
Taste caramel sugary sweets, spicy bitter, sour hint. 
Mouthfeel creamy, soft. 
Great beer.

Dark brown pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, fruit, spices and caramel. Taste of malts, yeast, caramel, plums, figs and spices. Medium bodied, perfect carbonation, very well balanced, excellent beer.

Flesje gekocht in Ieper. Donkerbruine kleur, veel kraag bij het inschenken , die ook lang blijft liggen. Ruikt zoetig maar ook wat zuur, alcohol, romig, licht fruitig, mout, wel complex eigenlijk maar niet persé lekker. Smaak is caramel, bitterzuur, wat zoet, alcohol. Bitterfruitige afdronk. Er zit vanalles in maar het is gewoon niet zo mijn smaak.
Spicy with dark fruit, brown sugar, and some mild tartness. Has a very dry mouthfeel, though nice raisin & plum flavors, and some slight toffee. Very good.

Great beer from one of the best breweries in the world. On tap. Poured a ruby brown with a a smallish white head. Nose is candied malt, fruit, light spice. Taste is dark fruit, sweet malt spice. Mouth is well carbonated and full. Finish is nice and smooth, alcohol is hardly noticed. Great beer!
Pours reddish-brown. Aroma of raisins and dried dark fruits. Fruity and sour sweetness with raisins and red wine.
330ml: Poured dark red brownish with tall beige head. Tastes sweet with licorice and toffee flavours. The ancohol presence is definitely felt.
Zuckriger Geruch, minimal Klebstoff. Bisschen bitter im Abgang. Alkohol gut versteckt. Insgesamt "geht so".
Aroma of caramel, toffe, belgian yeast and dms. The taste is similar. The dms really ruins this beer for me. Medium sweet finish.
This brown beer has a crem brûlée aroma with athe app isn't letting me see what I have written.

A nice Christmas beer. Pours a cloudy red/brown with a thick tan head. Smells of herbs, plums, anise. Taste had lots of dark fruit and herbs, with a spicy finish. Sort of like the trader Joe's vintage ale. Paired with fried Mac & cheese balls, taste is a bit sharper. Not much else. Had in the bottle.
Tap, brown pour, tan head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, some toffee, sweet

Bomber from Supermarket Liquors. Appearance: 2 fingers light tan head, copper brown color, cloudy, good lacing and head retention. Aroma: molasses, fruit, raisins. Palate: dry finish, light medium body, average carbonation. Taste: sweet molasses and fruit into a bit more solid malt background, light spice notes at the end. Overall, good beer, lovely balance, smooth, spice is very subtle.
Smells like christmas pudding and port, hazy dark brown thin lacing on top. Quite sweet and effervescent with nice fruity flavour cloying brown sugar finish
Farbe rotbraun mit kräftigen Schaum. Geruch schwach und leicht säuerlich. Geschmack nicht so intensiv, leichte Klebstoffaromen.

Bottle BB June 2018. Dark reddy brown, sparkling, absolutely massive foamy tan head keeps on expanding, sparse lacing. Aroma is cherry, raspberry, some yeast, musty spice. Body is medium, some spritz, quite foamy. Taste is dry and alcoholic, tangy chemical, earthy spice, rye bread. Very drying, but easy drinking despite this. Decent boozy sipper.

Keg. Appearance is very dark, almost black, a thick off-white head which lasts and leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, port, cherry, malty, nutty hints. Taste- full and quite rich, plenty of dark fruits, Christmas cake, marzipan, raisin, sugar, caramel sweetness, bready yeast. Very good indeed.

Beige creamy full lasting head. Dark brown colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (dates, cherries) with spicy and light alcohol notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity with banana, licorice and candy notes, ending in a fruity slightly spicy finish. Full bodied.

Appearance: slightly cloudy medium amber-orange, with short, creamy light tan head that was pretty resilient; decent carbonation.  Aroma: surprisingly fruity, with some cherry, raisins, light orange zest; then theres candi sugar, brown sugar, general Belgian yeasty notes (esp clove).  Taste: candi and brown sugar, light brown bread, some floral honey, hint of molasses, fruitcake plus a bit of banana, with some clove and cinnamon.  Finish: smooth palate that was lighter than expected (but not too light), belying the alcohol; there was a bit of lingering sweetness and spice. Notes: A Christmas beer that doesnt taste like pine sol or a holiday-themed candle. Thats just the bonus. A well-balanced, excellently-constructed Belgian ale. Pulled out of the beer fridge after a 2-year rest.
Deep brown color, beige head. Dried fruit nose, Belgian yeast, brown sugar, light spicy, hint of banana. Sweet taste, dried fruit, hints of alcohol and spice. Full body, soft carbonation.
Zwart bier zonder schuim. Smaak is heel licht zoet en sterk, ook ietwat droog. Heel licht anijs, en ondefinieerbare kruiden, kan het niet thuis brengen. Erg goed bier wat redelijk lang blijft hangen.

75 cl. bottle, shared. Hazy, brown colour with a reddish tint. Dense, creamy tanned head. Sweet aroma with dark, dried fruits, yeasts, nuts, rich caramel malts, "Christmas spices", candid sugar and hints of vineous alcohol. Taste is sweet. Full body with an oily texture. Carbonation starts lively, but fades quickly to a soft dotting. Long lasting sweet finish with caramel malts and dark, dried fruits. Some port-like notes. A very rich and filling beer that almost overpowers the othervise hearthy Christmas dishes. A solid choice for the season.

Draught at the beer & beyond party, agnes pub hod hasharon. Murky brown with creamy head. Christmas cake aroma: dough and cinnamon and nutmeg. Tastes a little tarty, some sour grapes. Full body, carbonated, a little tarty finish. I remember it sweeter and richer.

On 75 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Dark brown color, good offwhite foam- good carbonation. High aroma intensity; malt, dried fruits, very nice yeast influence and still some fruitness. Full body & high complexity. It definetly has some sweetness, but balances elegantly. Nice long aftertaste. Very enjoyable- by far the best christmas beer Ive tasted this year.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 dates, raisin, candy sugar, caramel and licorice. very estery and straight forward belgian, very boozy, and a slight leathery taste which is a negative... a bit too carbonated and gets quite boring..

On tap @Mad For Beer (Rome). Pours dark brown-mahogany, medium off-white head that rapidly disappears. Aroma is overripe fruits, esters, candy, brown sugar, spices. Flavour is very sweet, fruity (baked apple), candy, caramel, alcol. Full body, low carbonation. Just another Christmas beer...
Fruta madura, licor, especias y la levadura de la casa. Dulce y licorosa. Un poco más de cuerpo la haría más compensada y redonda.

Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. BBE 16 09 18. Colour is dark brown with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavors: Dark fruits, plums, raisins, Belgian yeast, some spices, hints of alcohol and malts.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Bottle of 75cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge.
Very nice Christmas Ale, with hot spicy and sugar notes, beautiful brown appearance.
Nice aroma and taste of Trappist yeast, moderate sticky palate.
Love it
Boa cerveja, com um bom final, sabor de aparência. Boa carbonatacao, não se sente o álcool na boca. No geral, uma boa cerveja!

750 bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a murky brown with three fingers of dense tan head that lasts a couple of minutes. It then fades leaving little lacing.
Aromas: Belgian yeast, appricots and candied fruit.
Flavours: Candied fruit, Belgian yeast, prunes, plums, figs, hop notes.
Mouthfeel: Moderate viscosity with high carbonation. 
Overall: A nice quadruple with lots going on in the way of aromas and flavours. It isnt something I would want to drink all the time but it is nice on occasion like at Christmas.
Lite dimming och brun aktig med ett brun-orange skum. Doft: Belgo, örter, kola, frukt, "godis malt", läsk. Smak: Malt, must, belgo, läsk.
bottle. Earthy red colour and large lively head. Malty, breads and caramel, dark fruit and apple. Spicy and boozy. Very lively carbonation. Nice winter warmer beer.

Bottle at home from drinkstorehazy dark chestnut with beige head collapsing to lacing. Fruity prunes, dates and candy sugar. Lively carbonation, fruity full bodied, sweet, apple. Fairly light bodied and not Ott on yeast esters.

Imposante mousse à la surface de cette bière rougeoyante mi-épaisse, qui présente aussi un nez acidulé qui rappelle même un peu les levures bretts, avec quelques fruits (baies, cerises) pour terminer. Bouche en punch aux fruits, riche et décadente, savoureuse et complexe, superbement balancée. Elle est un peu trop pétillante, comme cest souvent le cas pour cette brasserie, mais il sagit dun de leurs fleurons, un délice de tous les instants.

Pours a deep, hazy brown with an off-white head and lacing. The aroma is lots of spices like cinnamon and coriander with some dark fruit as well. The flavor is spices and rich malt up front with a solid backbone and slightly sweet finish over a heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a brown colour with a head that disappears quickly. I find its a fruitier version of the 12.

It pours brown with a full head that produces a fair amount of lacing. It has an aroma of fruit and spices. There is also a bit of alcohol and malts. Finally, there are earthly notes as well. There are flavors of spice, alcohol, yeast. It does have a moderate, dry bitter finish.

Pours a burnt amber color with an off white head. Yeast, fruit, spice, malt and sugar aroma. Yeast, raisin, plum, apple, banana,  fig, sugar , malt, caramel and spice flavors. Medium full body with lively carbonation. Fruit, yeast and caramel finish.
Tap at Lemmy's, Leiden: Dark brown colored brew with an sweet bitter taste, hints of chocolate, cinnamon and some banana.

750 mL bottle. Hazy Dr Pepper brown with a small beige head. Yeasty aroma. Fruity/yeasty flavour. High carbonation. Improves and fills out as it warms. Certainly not sweet, but it does sweeten as it warms. Some bitterness in the finish. Not bad, but not as good as some of their other offerings.
750 ml from the LCBO. Very aromatic, floral hops, sweet bready malt, herbal and funky yeast notes, banana. Taste follows suit, undetectable 10% abv. Very well balanced.
Wow. Bottle from Total Wine, enjoyed on Christmas eve after services. Might have to be a new Christmas tradition.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with tan colored head. Aroma is mostly fruity with spices. Plum and raisin notes with some spiciness that lingers on the palate. Rich and nuanced, I enjoyed this.

Osservazioni: Allaspetto è velata e di un bel color ambrato carico / marrone, con riflessi rossastri; molto bella anche la schiuma, compatta, cremosa, color ocra e molto persistente. Al naso profumi vinosi, sentori di prugna, zucchero caramellato, frutta candita, frutta matura; savverte anche qualche leggera nota aspra di amarena, ed una lieve speziatura (noce moscata). Lattacco è dolce, con caramello, uvetta sultanina e prugna disidratata, ben bilanciato da una leggera asprezza di frutti rossi (mirtillo rosso, ribes, prugna acerba); la bevuta quindi si alleggerisce progressivamente, con un finale quasi secco e molto pulito. Lamaro è impercettibile, il retrogusto è etilico, caldo e morbido, di nuovo a metà strada tra note dolci di uvetta e più aspre di frutti rossi. Il corpo è medio, la carbonazione abbastanza sostenuta.
330ml bottle from Congress, Longton. Pours deep red black brown with light tan. Good zing, stewed dark fruits, roast and a floral zip. Excellent.

Pours a rich mahogany with a big fluffy juicy soapy foamy head. Nose is Belgian yeast, bready, dark fruits. Taste is tons of yeast character, dark fruit esters, a bit of sweet malt, maybe some holiday spices if not its a spicy yeast. Very high carb, effervescent. Top tier beer, holiday or otherwise

75 cl/750 ml, flaske, 10,0 % ABV, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 24. december 2014.
Kastanje-brun jule-Ale med kæmpe offwhite-gaver skumkrone på 7-8 cm tykkelse. Kronen svinder i normalt tempo ned til gardiner, overflade og 1 cm tykkelse efter en halv snes minutter. 
"Traditionel" duft af belgisk stærk ale af engelsk plumcake og den gode tørrede frugt. Desuden gær, rosin, sveske, 
Smagen lægger syrligt ud. Grænsende til surt. Dernæst en dejlig balance mellem humlet bitterhed og sødme. Lang god smag med masser af syrligt modspil til den sædvanlige belgiske smag. 
Karboneringen er derimod på et niveau, som jeg finder alt for højt: Skummende i munden skal man finde smagen, og det kunne munkene gøre bedre. Middel stor krop og middel god konsistens: olieret. 
God og gedigen belgisk juleøl.
Wow this is surely a good treat for the Christmas season! Wonderful dark brown ale with a fruity nose and aroma of nuts and caramel. One of the best beers from the St. Bernardus Brewery!

Unlike some other sites, I dont see it being differentiated by year, so I will identify this review as being for the 2014 Vintage. 
Cherrywood brown in colour, crowned by an off-white head that is thick and lasting. Visible carbonation bubbles. The nose is flooded with prunes, pears, molasses, caramel malts, Tastes are very raisiny, prunes, Christmas spices, honey, and light candied orange.
As a winter warmer, this 10% abv, 750ml bottle is just the right thing. Given its name, I decided to uncork it on December 23rd. No regrets on that.

brown, clear, minimal head, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter
Purchased in winter 2012 and cellared for special occasion. Poured brownish ruby with short lived tan foam. Decent lacing. Big aromas of dark candied fruit and sweet bread. Bitter sweet initially with a dark rum heat slowly building to the finish. Average to light carbonation, with a mid range body. Seemed to stick on the tongue a bit, and coat the mouth - bitter sweetness lingers on well into the finish. Best $18 CAD beer I have ever had!

Backlog rating. 75cl bottle from A Tutta Birra, Milano. It pours a dark brown color with a large beige head. Aroma is sweet with cinnamon and raisins, with hints of X-mas spices. Taste is again sweet with notes of plum and raisins. Mild alchol booze in the finish. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty
Light brown and heavily spice ale. High gravity is hidden in the smooth taste.
Een echt kerstbier, donker en zwaar. Heel complex met een heel gamma aan aromas en smaken.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Bottle. Amber-brown color with small head. A tartness in the aroma is immediately noticeable. Fruity-sweet and lots of spices, cinnamon, rosemary, and the likes, a bit more tart than the Abt 12, but not as rich and complex. The fruitiness is more berries-like. A high-level brew.

Anbefalet af Jesper Lyngholm. 

Helt mørk med et gyldent skær. Tykt fyldigt blivende skum. Syrlig næse med skovfrugt og en anelse humle. Starter syrligt bitter med lidt citrus og masser af kulsyre og krydderi. Lang sødlig eftersmag. Fin juleale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear reddish copper with a long lasting thin off white head and lots of lace. Aroma is dark dried fruits, mild alcohol, perfumy, and some spicy/fruity Belgian yeast notes. Flavour is malty, dark dried fruits, rasins, perfumy, mild alcohol, spicy Belgian yeast. My kind of

From a bomber. Pours a ruby amber brown and makes a typical thick StB head. Aroma of dark fruits and cinnamon and maybe cardamom and yeast. Tastes of raisins, malt, and spice. A beautiful ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Buona bevuta. Scura,schiuma bianco sporco, panjosa. Odori di liquirizia,castagne e prugne. In bocca è lo stesso,con tocchi di anice improvvisi. Buono il finale,lungo e caldo. Corpo medio rotondo, tessitura quasi oleosa.

December 21, 2014. Bottle at home. 
Murky amber/brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel, raisins, some spicy and earthy notes. Taste is sweet dried fruits and caramel with a light spicy bitter finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Igazi karácsonyi hangulatot árasztó főzet mind csomagolásában, mind elegáns megjelenésében, megnyerő illataiban. Elragadó szerecsendiós, szegfűszeges, éles kontúrú aromák kelnek útra, a vibráló ízjegyek hírnökei ezek. Magabiztosan hordozza megannyi fűszer, kandiscukor, vérpezsdítő vörösbor hangulatát, élénk teste a magas alkoholfok ellenére is józanítóan hat. Klasszikus ünnepi hangvételű alkotás, annak minden tökéletességével együtt.

Medium dark brown- huge tan head. Aroma is yeasty, musty, dried fruit with effervescent sweetness. Taste o candy sugar, banana, raisin, candied oranges, apricots. Finish is toffee and fermenting fruits. Unique, yet so very Belgian in character.

Bottle. Pours a reddish copper, creamy khaki head, islands of lace. Nose is spicy, malt, sugar, caramel. Tastes sweet, slightly bitter, decent spice, Im getting a little cinnamon, caramel, a little hot. I like the spice.
Draft. Dark reddish brown with little head. Lots of spice in the aroma but the taste is dominated by syrupy cherry fruitiness. Medium sticky mouthfeel. Ok.
Bottle from LCBO. Pumpkin spice aroma. Sweet caramalt and spice taste. Dry finish. Nice festive ale.
Really nice. Full, round mouthfeel and great dark caramel color. Maybe my favorite Christmas beer.

33 cl bottle at home, BBE date July 2018. Pours a deep red-brown colour, thin head which soon disappears. Aroma of fruit, sweet malt and just a hint of the usual spices. Taste is of juicy sweet malt and fruit soaked in booze. Again, there is spicing in there, but it is subtle and not overpowering. On the palate the beer is quite effervescent to start, making a lively drink, but it soon settles. Nice dry finish. Overall, not bad. I think this would mature quite nicely, so the others go back into storage for a year or two.

Guys befote rating this one waaaait few minutes and give this beer the needed time to become much better after 10 or more minutes after pouring. Fruits and spices in the nose. Dark hazy colour with white head. Taste: seconds after pouring is very spice of sweet bakery. Than become more fruity...malty...better and better. Full body, small carbonation, hidden alcohol...pure x-mass happiness

75cl bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dirty brown with some festive red tints in a rather dull looking beer with practically no head. Roasted notes and chocolate in the nose, but discretely. The taste is sweet and yeasty, with some very powerful notes of licorice that provides a bitter backdrop. The bitterness linger in the aftertaste. The effervescence is very high, almost overly so. Its not a bad beer by yards, this, but not the best beer from the folks at Watou either.
Dark brown color with a light beige head. Aroma is fruity, ripe bananas, Belgian yeast. Taste of ripe dark fruit with boozy background.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Barril @Cerveceria Suco. Valladolid  07/12/2014
Botella, 09/12/16
Color marron, sabor malta, dulce, cuerpo medio.

330ml bottle. Trembling Madness Drinks Shop, York. Hazy amber. Thin, bubbly, tan head. Nutty, spicy, dark fruit. Sweet, cakey malts. Dried stone fruits. Figs. Dates. Mixed spice. Very festive. Taste is fruity dry. Lots of chewy sweetness. Just a hint of bitter at the end. Feels way under the ABV. Too much carbonation at first, but settles down after half an hour, at which point it matches the beer better. Finishes chewy sweet. Fruity dry. Very nice.
Bottle 750 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Pours reddish brown with white head. Dark fruits, bit yeasty, caramel, spices. Sweet. Warming alcohol. Good beer, but cant say Im thrilled.

Tap at Muddy Pig. Tulip glass. Sediment filled, hazy cola like color. Sweet aroma...almost a dark fruit with elements of earthiness. Taste is super smooth. Dark, tart fruits and hints of cocoa. Almost a milkshake in the mouth feel. Some sourness expected from high alcohol Belgian ales. Too rich not to savor. Ill awesomely seek out again. Merry Christmas to YOU, St. Bernardus!
Fruity, spicy, some caramels, the yeast strain seems to do a lot of the heavy listing. Almost a little tart from just how fruity it is. Maybe my favorite St. Bernardus release?

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours deep dark brown with a sweet malt and caramel aroma. Taste is moderately sweet, with soothing dark elements.. brilliantly balanced and hugely enjoyable from beginning to end. Found it hard to differentiate between this and the Abt12, apparently more spice in this.. I guess Ill have to try them both again to compare. Outstanding beer anyway and reaffirms St Bernardus as making some of the finest Belgian beer in my opinion.

A delicious beer if not exactly my style, as its fairly sweet. A treat for Christmas, nonetheless. Dark cloudy brown with white head and beautiful lacing in the specialized glass. Aroma is booze, raisin, hint of funk. Taste is molasses, currant, raisin, a range of sweet dark fruit, medium spice. Finish is dry enough not to cloy. Would be great with a caramel dessert.
Very, very sweet. Cloyingly syrupy with notes of brown sugar, apricots, and spices. Not a bad Christmas beer but definitely too sweet for me.

Finally, there we are, the perfect Christmas ale! In the glass the deep amber body looks slightly hazy and it has a huge, beige, long-lived head that ends up as a thin layer and foamy patches on the walls of the glass. Sweet, fruity and strong aroma of caramel, dark dried fruits, dark candi sugar, Belgian yeast and a general spicy feel. In the mouth I also get lots of caramel, notes of anise seeds and well integrated pleasant alcohol. Despite the moderate sweet taste and lots of sweet caramel, a moderate to light bitterness and the spices and yeast ensure that the brew feels crisp and drinkable. Close to full body, smooth texture, moderate carbonation. Brilliant stuff! 
[75 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 33 cl bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown color with white head. Dark fruit, molasses, malty aromas. Spiced, brown sugar, malty, a touch of alcohol in the flavors. One of the best Belgian Christmas ales.

Backlog. Bottle shared at RichTheVillans, 27/11/13. Pours dark brown, big cream head. Nose of raisins, prunes, dark caramel, Xmas spices, massive yeast esters. Tastes sweeeeeet caramel, cinder toffee, layers of dried fruit, dark christmas cake spice, just the barest hint of hop bitterness, finishes fairly dry despite starting sticky. Pretty well carbed to help keep it light. Prototypical, but a bit much if Id had more than just a share.

White light head. Steady carbonation through the entire sipping completing 650 ml. Classic Belgium yeast aroma with raising and and tart finish. Top notch for Christmas!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Everytime folk are about to write off Belgian brewing as past it or lacking the depth I end up drinking something from the land of Jacques Brel which reminds me of their world class quality. And today it is this which not only rewards aging but holds up in the glass over time showing huge strength, complexity and poise. This dark brown beauty is virtually immune to any deterioration in the glass morphing through a beautiful range of thrilling and haunting flavours and textures. From pear dropto light spice to a velvety smoothness to almost a sous bois quality, it is all there. The head actually builds the longer it is in the glass and the beading is just effortless.
Delicious Christmas-time brew. Pours a nice dark brown with a head that just doesnt quit. Caramel, malt, and maybe a little bit of fruitcake, too.

Spritig, fruktig doft med framför allt banan och torkade fikon som dominerande inslag. Söta karamellartad maltkaraktär blandas med örtkryddiga körsbärstoner. 
Stort, tätt skum med enastående stabilitet och perfekta lämningar. En vackert mörkt kopparbrun färg.
Malt och toner av frukt och kandisocker lyfter en tät komplex smak som dock inte är så söt som väntat. 
Kroppen är helt fyllig och med en brusande, skummande kolsyra av lite för stor mängd. Annars mjukt sammetsartad.
Eftersmaken är inte så stor men mycket angenäm med frukt och en svag beska.

11.2 oz bottle poured into chalice. Wonderful aroma with a string fruit nose. Pours a dark brown or a slight red tint. Not as nice of a head in it as delirium noel, but a nice head that dissipates a little. Tastes very smooth and rich, creamy mouthfeel. Notes of belgium yeast, malt and some slight fruit and spice notes. A great holiday ale.

Wazig roodachtig bruin bier met een beige schuimkraag.
Aroma van donker fruit, mout, kruiden en alcohol. 
Smaak is zoet, karamelmouten, specerijen.
Afdronk is licht bitter, alcohol komt sterk naar voor.

Bottle from We Brought Beer, Balham, London - mahogany brown coloured pour with firm beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, caramel, fudge, toffee, chocolate, with some earthy yeasts, warming boozy, great herbal and spicy notes throughout. Beautiful.

75cl bottle. Dark brown colour with a generous off-white head. Caramel, malt, spices and dark fruits in the aroma. Average carbonation and full bodied. Taste is more on the sweet side with some black chocolate and aged port wine notes. Overall, a very good beer.

On tap at the Turbacci Xmas fest nearby Rome-ITALY. Pours deep and dark brown with Amber signs and a creamy dense ivory head which leaves an amazing lacing. Nose: perfect complexity of velvet notes, light spices, dry figs, all of this resulting in a refreshing feel. Great. Mouth: chestnut honey all around the mouth, pungent spices feel, tangerine, fresh-complex and great. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home (75 cl). Pours a hazy reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits, malts, spices and alcohol. Taste is sweet, caramel malts, spices, warming alcohol, slightly bitter aftertaste, bit harsh even. Not bad, but far from the abt 12.

Dark brown with a light tan head. Spiced nose, cloves and barreled sweet wine. Full bodied with a high carbon and oily texture. Taste is sweet, Palate is dominated by ripe plums and cherries, Porto wine, Christmas spice and very dark chocolate. Sweet and bitter finish.
