Bottle drunk whilst watching forgotten Michael J. Fox masterpiece The Secret Of My Succe$s. Pours a reddish mahogony with a beige head. Aroma is boozy and rich. MAlt and candy sugar. Fruit on the spoil. Nice full body. Sweet and malty with a barely disguised alcohol. I love this kind of gear. Made me think of the Van Der Keiser Blauw. Delicious.
Bottle from SB, stored since christmas 2013. Pours two fingers of head. Aroma and taste is malty and with a lot of caramel. Almost lika a barley wine. Good, but I think I prefer the abt 12!
Aromas of cherry, spice, cooked sugar, pink grapefruit. Hazy red, lasting fluffy off-white head. Fruity, sweet but balanced by earth and spice. Medium bodied. Delicious!

Bottle. Medium brown, beige head quickly receding. Aroma banana, cinnamon, reminiscent of the St. Bernardus quad (one of my favourites). The body surprisingly light for the high ABV, quite strongly carbonated. Taste bananas, dried plums. Not bad, but quite far behind the quad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy brown with thin Lacy beige head; aroma is tart and yeasty; Flava is tart fruit and notes of wood and spice; feels medium to light; finishes sweet and herbally spicy

Bomber
APPEARANCE - light copper color, slightly turbid. 
FLAVOR - excellent robust flavor Belgian beer. Very complex.
NOTES - excellent brew. Surprisingly great considering how it looks when poured.
Bottle from Hopduvel. Pours dark brown with a very big head. Nose is banana, raisins, caramel. Taste is quite complex, spices, banana, malt, toffee. Excellent Belgian strong.

ASPETTO: colore mogano scuro con riflessi rossastri. Schiuma finissima e pannosa, abbondante e persistente, con tonalità rosa chiarissimo.
AROMA: maltato e speziato, con una punta di erbaceo. Man mano che la bevuta va avanti e la birra si scalda, si avvertono toni liquorosi, come di grappa.
GUSTO: pieno e avvolgente. Maltato, caramelloso, fruttato (chiara albicocca) e speziato. Note di frutta secca nel finale. Se lasciata riscaldare, si avvertono anche i sentori del luppolo, senza mai però aumentare lamaro, che rimane in pratica impercettibile. Retrogusto avvolgente e persistente. Carbonizzazione bassa. Corpo abbastanza strutturato.
CONCLUSIONE: birra favolosa, non stanca mai, non diventa mai stucchevole e che offre sempre nuove emozioni mentre la bevi. Da meditazione, ma secondo me offre il meglio se abbinata a cibi abbastanza strutturati. Ancora una volta St Bernardus non delude!

Pours a clear dark brown with a frothy white head. Aroma of dark dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, plums and light alcohol. Taste is dark dried fruits, plums, dates, brown sugar, caramel and a smooth warming alcohol on the finish... Well balanced, rich and complex. Great Christmas beer and Belgian dark strong.
Tap. Dark brown pour. Banana, spice, caramel, toffee. Nice carbonation. Medium body. Nice

Aroma: intense caramel, light cloves and spices, banana. Appearance: slightly hazy, dark amber, massive, frothy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: lively carbonation, banana, caramel, turning very slightly bitter after intense caramel and toffee malts. Overall: excellent Belgian Strong Ale, fantastic aroma and palate, yet maybe a bit too fizzy. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.

Couleur brune, reflets caramel, bonne mousse beige. Super nez fruité, levures belges, fruits noirs, note de banane. Gout malté, caramel, fruité banane, levures, pain dépice, note douces fruits noirs et reglisse. Corps bien rond et presque cremeux en bouche. Aromes intenses et bière super buvable. Fin bien longue en bouche avec toutes les mêmes saveurs . Un top!

Smells beautiful, red fruit, light caramel, dark malt and a bit of candi sugar. Very brown and hazy, extremely thick off-white head. Took a long time for the head to come down. Beautiful taste, upfront notes of caramel and toffee, finishes with some leafy bitterness and belgian yeast with some apple-like flavors as well. Alcohol extremely well hidden. Not too complex, but very well balanced and smooth beer. Medium carbonation and highly carbonated. Great belgian strong.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is spiced dark fruits, yeast, spicy malts, spiced rum, malts, dried red banana. Taste is spicy oatmeal, sour fruit, plums / prunes, dough. Mouthfeel is sparkly, effervescent up front with a smooth, creamy finish. Heavenly. One thing... these monks are mystically hiding the booze. 10%? Cant taste it but its punishing me.

Pours a cloudy ligh brown brew with a big reddish head with good retention, atoma is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with bannan, dried fruits, colve, caramel and species, medium to robust bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with a sweet finish and a medium aftertaste, very good
Spicy aroma. Very spicy taste. Thick mouthfeel. Sweetness. Tasty, but definitely need to slow-sip, and no more than one a day. The 10% ABV is well-hidden.
Nice brown color, little head. Rich aroma containing malt, caramel and hops. Full body, lively carbonation. Taste is complex, bitter and sweet.

Poured into Trappist glass a bottle glass brown with huge tan head. Head jumps from bottle on opening with curtians of lace. Aroma hits you as nutty at first an aroma that you can pick up feet away. Banana, clove, candy sugar, dark fruits. Complex in aroma as the taste. I get a lot of banana with spice. Some dark fruits and a nice malty backbone. Alcohol hidden for a 10%er. Mouthfeel is a light syrup and the finish is banana. Amazing.
A highlight of the holiday season, St Bernardus Christmas Ale arrived this week. Dark, dark brown with a dense tan head. Nose is dark fruit and spices. Taste follows the nose. Outstanding seasonal.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2015 Donkerbruin met een beige kraag. Aroma van kruidnagel, karamel en suiker. Zoet en licht bitter. Volle body.

Aroma of malt, candied sugar, Belgian yeast, banana nutty and clove like spices. Nice foamy head that lasts a while. Taste is malty and sweet, with some nice subtle spices. Well balanced, very full flavored and not overly sweet for a quad. Very well done. Like the abt 12 with some slight spice. Works quite well with this beer. I like that it is not over spiced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg @ CK. Medium Amber with a small head. Im Nose is gingerbread, general spice rack. Belgian yeast. Cocoa. Taste is sort of spicy. Dry ginger, earth. Toffee me cocoa. Spices. Full body, rich. Meh.
Grayish with a strong light brown head. Nose has spices and bread. Mouth has liqorice, spices and herbs.

Deep dark red-brown colour with a foamy dark white head and good lacings. Clear yeasty barnyard aromas supported by fruity, caramel and alcohol herbal aromatic notes arise. At first soft carbonated the beer develops a tangy effervesent texture. Flavours of sweet fruityness, caramel malts and brown sugar are predominant. The finish is offering some herbal sweet-bitter notes lasting relatively long.

Brownish ruby colour, off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, nuts, clove, a bit booze. Taste is light sweet, a bit bitter, spicy flavour. Medium to full body, oily to creamy texture, average carbonation. Very nice.

750ml bottle 
10.0% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
November 20, 2014 
The 2014 Birthday beer. The beer pours a murky reddish brown with a huge generous rocky light tan coloured head that lasts. The aroma yeast, dark fruits, fresh baked bread, roasted malt, and spices. The mouthfeel was full-bodied with above average carbonation. The flavour was dark malt, plums, nutmeg, yeast, and roasted malt. ANother great beer from my favourite brewer!
Brune foncée, effervescence forte, col beige crémeux et aérien. Malts légèrement torréfiés, caramel, un peu de réglisse, épicée, chaleur dalcool assez présente.

De couleur brune ruby; la mousse et de couleur blanc cassé .. 
Au nez on va sentir des notes de café réglisses et alcool 
embouchoir on retrouve très légèrement le réglisse ainsi que le café 
L'amertume n'est pas trop présente 
Une très bonne bière de Noël !!!
Rated based on notes taken 17 Dec 2011 -- Sampled at a tasting. Very nice Christmas-y beer. Great for this time of year.

Brown and unclear. Beige head, medium lasting. Spicy aroma, mint, cardamon. Lactic-acid notes. Too sharp and unpleasent. Rerate: Aged a couple of years, much more harmonic now. Aroma of faint spice and herbs, a lot of different ones, almost harmonic. Flavor is mainly sweet. More spice. Some mint, grain.

Murky brown with a creamy tan foam. Raisins and nutmeg on the nose with a touch of sugar. Body is full with fine carbonation. Dark fruit flavors with a bit of alcohol. Clean finish leaves me wanting more. Nice.

Super bomber into a pint. Pours a cherry cola murky amber red brown. Head is enormous at first, mounting a few inches, then subsides to a thin layer of white cream foam. Lacing is light and spotty. Aroma of spices of Xmas, orange, nutmeg, and coriander. Taste of sweet apple, orange, melded malt s of Belgium, and evasive hops. Great beer for the season.

absolutely loved this one. despite the high alcohol, not too powerful. good fruity and sugary flavor. some raisins, brown sugar and cherries. very solid seasonal ale. wish i had more of this. near perfect brew.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Arômes réglisse, malt. Au palais biere plus légère qu'attendu. Palais réglisse, café. Bonne effervescence. Très bonne.

750 ml bottle, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours a rich, deep bronze-brown, and forms a fantastically thick head with good retention. Fairly clear, enough to see the bubbles rising from the bottom. Lacing is rather remarkable - this amount of froth and lacing should not even be possible for a 10% ABV beer!

S: Sweet malt and yeast, wreathed through with plum, fig, and cherry notes. The candi sweetness is of course present, along with just a tinge of funk.

T: So, thats what a quad with cinnamon in it tastes like. Theres significant heat in this, from a combination of cinnamon spice with noticeable alcohol. Sweet malt, candi sugar, and dark fruits, particularly cherry, are all present, but beneath the spiceahol mix. The finish leaves a lingering burn.

M: Rather thin and sharply carbonated for a quad, actually. I was expecting something stickier, given the head and lacing.

O: I am rather underwhelmed by this beer, especially from St. Bernardus. The Abt 12 is spectacular, but this does not disguise the alcohol content half as well - instead, it disguises the underlying yeast flavors with alcohol and spice. I wouldnt say it is a bad beer, but I would not go out of my way to have it again. Perhaps if I were to encounter it on tap somewhere for a decent price per pour.

750 mL bottle. Pours deep mahogany with a thick off white head. Aroma is fruity--decidedly more so than their ABT 12. Sweet cherry, plum, overripe pear and apple. Some light brown sugar tones, fig cake, yeasty brown spices. Sweet, balanced with high carbonation and alcohol. Full bodied, creamy palate. Very pleasent overall. A little hot, should cellar well.

750ml corked and caged bottle from the lcbo. Very dark, hazy brown, with a huge light beige head. Loads of dark fruit, plums, stone fruit, candied apples, light pear even some booze soaked fruit cake. Lively carb, but yet still soft at the same time. Loads of sweet bready malts in the finish, with more fruit. A great sipping beer, another great beer from St bernardus!

Corked and caged 750 ml bottle shared with Dad. Pours dark reddish brown, some purple color, creamy one finger white to off white head. Aroma has much more fruit character than the 12, with lots of sweet cherry notes, caramel malts, funky Belgian yeast of course, and candi sugar. Much more muted hop notes here than the 12 as well. Flavor follows the smell closely with big sweet fruit flavors--tastes like the added cherries to this one, but cant find info on fruit additions--light spice, candi sugar and sweet malts. Very smooth and pleasant. Sweet but not cloying. Medium carbonation and plus body. This was really nice.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2016 Dal colore tonaca di frate con riflessi rubini,  con schiuma cremosa avorio ma evanescente.  Al naso sprigiona note fruttate,di frutta sotto spirito e note legnose. Ottimo equilibrio tra i malti caramellati e lo zucchero. Al palato ancora fruttato (ciliege sottospirito e albicocche disidratate). Corpo medio con carbonazione finissima.

Bottle from the LCBO. Dark and cloudy, with the same huge beige head as the 12. Very fruity, cranberry is present, some soft chocolate aromas, granola, raspberry and alcohol. Sweetness is very predominant.
Draft. Dark and cloudy appearance. Sweet aroma. Delicious. Just very delicious and nothing is wrong with it.
(Tap) very tasty beer. Not nearly as spiced as I was fearing. Wonderful sipping beer.

Pours a dark copper brown a little hazy, aroma is bready malt and dark fruit, lots of raisin. Flavor is sweet bready malt, some light caramel and some raisins and plums. Slight warming on the finish, the balance is towards the sweet side. Delicious beer.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Very big creamy foamy head. Hazy deep dark red ish brown to almost black colored beer.
Aroma and flavour are very fruity, but specially for the flavour the time of airing makes this a more subtle beer in which the (fruity) sweetness becomes less and more balance with bitters and other ingredients like malts, herbs, yeast and some dried leaves with caramel tones.
The aftertaste is fruity, in the background. The malts and hay and caramel are more present than in the flavour itself.
Overall I would say store this away for a year or two and open one than, must become better with some years. This does not mean its bad but it tastes a bit young I guess...
Carbonation level is quite low and causes the mouhfeel to be creamy. The body is more than medium because of all the flavours mixed (or not mixed) are pretty strong present. Very decent beer with a soul and body, but with some time it should evolve into a smarter liquide mix of malts, water, hops and yeast.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle pour. Dark brown with a large creamy tan head. Dark fruits, licorice, raisins, and bread aroma. Creamy full body. Dark fruit, raisin, spices, and bread taste.

Rotbraune Farme mit stabiler, beiger Schaumkrone. Malzig-süßlich-angenehmer Geruch. Der Antrunk ist schwer, aber gleichzeitig auch mild-weich. Malzig. Zum Hauptteil kommen sehr angenehm mild-malzige Aromen durch. Ein Hauch von Zimt und Gewürzspekulatius, zusammen mit einer angenehm-malzig-süßlicher Note. Mild-weich, die 10% sind nicht zu schmecken! Dunkle Früchte, tiefgehende Aromen. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, schön mild-weich, dunkel, malzig-süßlich, angenehm dunkel-vergorene Note.  → ein klasse Weihnachtsbier! 13/13/14/14

Poured from bottle, dark brownish amber with low creamy head. Aroma strong with notes of dark bread, dried fruit, spices and herbs. Taste is full bodied with notes of dark bread, honey, resin, dried fruit and herbs. Long lasting rewarding finish.

750ml served in a La Trappe Trappist chalice.

A: Pours a dark amber to brown color with a big creamy fluffy beige head. A bit cloudy. Good retention. A thin layer is always there and many lacings are left

S: Mainly dark fruits and caramel. Plums, dates, figs and raisins. Caramel malts, Belgian yeasts, toffee and alcohol in the end

T: Follows the nose: Dark fruits, toffee, caramel malts and Belgian yeasts. Sweet taste and mild on bitterness, quite bready as a traditional Belgian strong Ale. Alcohol can be also felt in the end

M: Full creamy and molasses body. Medium carbonation. Alcohol in the end

O: Very drinkable and tasty beer. Exactly what you expect from a St. Bernardus beer... An excellent beer! ;)
[ BA Review @ 2/5/2012 ]

Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark colour with medium white head.Taste and aroma of caramel, raspberry, blueberry, brown sugar.Very good only I think to need a little bit more complex flavour.

Christmas beer from Sint-Bernardus largely destined for export to Danemark (unfortunately, I hasten to add). Tasted at ZBF last year. Light beige head, dark burgundy colour, complex fruity and malty aroma, chocolate, raisins, grapes, cloves, liquorice, cinnamon, caramel; complex taste, deep and soft malty, spicy but fortunately in a subtle way adding to the complexity, sweetish but never cloying, full and creamy mouthfeel, herbal hoppiness in the finish along with warming alcohol. Not very creative for the style but, as usual with this range, very well crafted and complex. Great beer, in other words.

"another very solid ale from St B, but im afraid i still think they are a touch overated...good, but definitely not one of the best. heavier feel, carbonation too high. lots of spicy and fruity belgian yeast character. good but not great."

Cloudy brown color, big off-white to tan head. Huge lacing. Dark fruits, biscuit, brown sugar, malt and berries aroma. Boozy. Heavy sweetness. Full body, flat carbonation. Creamy texture. This is like Christmas cake with alcohol and fruits. 
(Svijet Piva 0,75l bottle)
Bottle. Hazy amber liquid with big yellowish head. Medium to full body, medium to light carbonation. Very sweet. Fruity and alcoholy. Something like wine in aftertaste. A bit hard to drink.
Bottle shared w/ Tim. Dark ruby brown off-white lacing foam. Sweet caramel aroma and taste, bit too sweet. But may be I should not drink a Christmas beer in August. (Efteling 201408)
Cloudy brown color, big tan, uneven, staying head. Full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of brown sugar, malts, yeast, banana, mulled wine, dark fruits. Medium sweet taste. Very good christmas ale.
DWF; Bottle from Cardinal, Bottle 1,5l. White thick head.Aroma is malt and caramel, fruity, alchol and yeast.Taste is sweet and sour.

Amber brown, thin light tan head, scant malty aroma. Full mouth, light chocolate start with caramel, but not too sweet. Id like to try this one after laying it down for 3 or 4 years - hopefully will become more complex

33cl flesje via Être Gourmet
Alcoholpercentage van 10%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: hazelnoot kleurig, minimale schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: banaan, donker fruit, kruidig, caramel

Conclusie: lekker bier, maar niet helemaal mijn smaak. Ook geen kerst nu natuurlijk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Transfer from BA review on 12-4-12-
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer was served a deep mahogany colored brew with a decent haze and a thick one finger head. The head faded holds on for some time, eventually fading to give a decent level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma was heaviest of dark fruit aromas of plum, raisin and some fig. Mixed with these aromas is a very subtle spice (cinnamon and nutmeg) aroma as well as a yeast aroma and a little bit of banana.

 Taste  The taste begins with the dark sweet fruits that were detected in the nose. The raisin and prune character of the taste are soon joined by a yeasty taste as well as a spice flavor. While the spice starts off on the weaker side it soon grows stronger with flavors of cinnamon and nutmeg becoming more potent. Flavors of a banana nature and some bready tastes then come to the tongue. These flavors all mingle together to in the end , with the advent of some alcohol taste, leave a warming fruity spiced taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel The body of the beer is quite creamy with a carbonation level that is rather moderate. The creamy body is fantastic as it baths the tongue in the fruit, bready, and warming alcohol flavors of the brew. The carbonation seems to add just the right excitement to the mouthfeel to complement the spice tastes. Overall rather pleasant.

 Overall  Quite tasty of fruit, warming and just the right amount of spice. A delicious winter warmer.
Een deftig kerstbier zoals het hoort te zijn, met veel smaak aan. Er zijn er betere maar zeker ook slechtere.

DWF; Bottle from Cardinal, Bottle 1,5l. thank you! Aroma is special malt and caramel, ripe fruit, alchol, complex and spesial. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, warming and sweet lasting. Body, texture and carbonation is it.

Dark brown pour with frothy white tall head. It's 10% Alc is obvious with each mouth full. Has a somewhat effervescent feel in the mouth with a hint of bitter at the end. Over all nice darker Abby Ale

Large bottle served in a large Piraat tulip.

A: Dark but clear red-brown body. Large, durable, off-white foamy head,with exceptional lacing. Patchy sticky lace decorates the glass well after tipping. 

Aroma: Dark fruits and dark bread crust. Faint spices. yeast and an unforutnate touch of must. 

Flavor: Sweet, but not overly so, with hints of toffee and brown sugar. Hints of spices including nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla. A suggestion of rum. Dark fruit in abundance. No mustiness, thankfully. Complex and layered. Faint, ripe banana.

Feel: medium body. Medium-heavy but soft carbonation makes for a light and lively feel.. Smooth, sticky and gently warming. 

O: More like an ABT 12 than St. Bernardus Prior 8. Better than the Prior 8 and, if not for the aroma, it would be better than the ABT 12 too. Despite the Xmas theme, quite enjoyable in the summer. Highly recommended.
Very malty and herbal beer. Sweet as well of course, but in a good way. The spices balance the sweetness that mostly dominates christmas beers.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe [040514]
Very dark brown, big frothy tan head, good lacing
Aroma of sweet dark fruits, touch of port, sweet yeast esters, no alcohol, superb fruity malt aromas
Taste of caramel malts, dark fruit cake fruits, touch spicy, raisin malts, hint of date, soft candi sugar, some alcohol, slight bready malts
Palate - medium carb, medium to full body, fairly sweet. Finish as main flavour, light fruit cake spices, nice fruity malts, some warming alcohol.
Overall - Really nice malty beer, but not as good as Abt 12

Bottle at home, my brothers birthday, 2012, cheers mate! Dark brown with a nice but quickly fading tan head. Aroma is quite complex, Belgian yeast, spice, dark fruit. Flavour is similar, bit of a boozy punch in there. Quite enjoyed it but not as much as I thought I would.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig süß, überreife dunkle Früchte, leicht würzig. Geschmack fruchtig malzig, überreife Früchte, nur leicht alkoholisch.

Bona cervesa, molt maltosa, dolça i acaramelada, millor beure-la poc a poc.
Buena cerveza, muy maltosa, dulce y acaramelada, mejor tomarla despacio.

Bottle. Dark red body, big lasting white head. Aroma of prunes, caramel, plum. Massive taste of dried fruit, yeast, caramel, light bitterness, sweet spicy finish with a full orange fruity aftertaste. A very nice beer!

Time for a little Christmas in April. Saw this single bottle sitting on a shelf at a local store and couldnt help but to pick it up.

Pours a deep mahogany with a thick and fluffy cream colored head. Looks fantastic. Aroma is fresh dough, slightly earthy, fruit cake, and maple syrup. Flavor is dark fruits, holiday baking spices, booze, brown sugar, and a bitterness that lingers throughout. Quite tasty. Perfectly carbonated and feels prickly on the palate and goes down smooth.

Det här var intressant, aromen hintade om tuggummi men inget tuggummi kunde hittas i smaken. Däremot kunde jag hitta belgisk jästkultur, råsocker och jord i smaken, kroppen var stabil till tisen och balansen var riktigt fin den också.
Pours a dark brown with a creamy head, floral nose with a hint of plum. Alcohol doesnt power thru as much as the abt. Great beer

Wow, wish I had more of these, aroma is fruity to piney, spruce Christmas tree with some fruitcake, taste is malty, somewhat fruity, slight spice, alcohol, moderate lacing present, medium aftertaste. Great beer!
Bottle. Very dark brown beer. Good cream colored head. Taster is crisp. Nice dry malt cream. Some nice spice. Just a half step below Abt 12.

750 ml. bottle poured into a schooner. Pours a reddish brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of raisin, sweet malt, alcohol, cherry, and plum. The flavor is not very distinct, very malt forward with a slight sourness from the yeast and hardly any spice. It has fruity esters and is a rich beer but something is missing. I do detect some cinnamon and ginger, but very slight. It has a medium to full body, fairly light texture, lively carbonation, and long, sweet, alcohol laden finish. Very fizzy on the palate. Kind of boring, actually.

Looks the part, smells the part, feels the part........but it didnt taste the part. I dont know, I feel wrong for not tasting much in this besides a little bit of spice and dark fruit but I was disappointed with the lack of flavor. However, it did smell great, look great and had a nice full body with a smooth finish. A pretty good beer but............

Ruby coloured with a vigorous pale head. Aroma is dark fruit, ginger, anise, brown sugar. Full bodied, sweet on the palate with a big Belgian yeast finish. Taste is christmas spices, raisins, dates, coriander, ginger. Tasty
As it is a young beer, is its wine equivalent the Beaujolais Nouveau? Pours dark brown. Grapey scent and sweet dark fruit flavors. Mid bodied and quite live. Draft - Brick Store Pub - Decatur, GA

pours very dark, almost black and appearing cloudy with thick foamy head. smells of spice and fruit with some alcohol scent (it is 10% afterall). Tastes the same with a moderate alcohol finish with end of spice. A very tasty beer and a go to if I dont feel like experimenting.
Bottle that pours reddish brown with a big head. It was more carbonated than I expected but that does not take away from the beer. Malty with hints of spices, a very tasty Christmas ale.

Bottle. Dark color, tan head, huge carbonation. Smell is fruity, yeasty, spicy; similar to the 12 with a little more cinnamon in it. Taste is very similar to the 12, so it cant be that bad, right? Good beer, of course. I dont think they make a bad one. 1000 people before me talk about how good it is, so something can be said for that.

Bottle 0.33L.
Dark brown body with a huge, creamy, tan head, fully lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate malty aroma (caramel) with notes of dark fruits, nuts, raisins and light spices.
Moderate-to-heavy and nicely balanced bitter/sweet flavour. 
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation; light alcoholic warming in the finish.
Very satisfactory!
Bottle. Color red brown with large head. Aroma dried fruits, yeast, spicy. Taste caramel, fruits, alcohol, yeast.
Bottled. Pours cloudy brown with a small brown head. Smells candy malt, chocolate and some apricot. Tastes sweet candy malt, apricot and roasted malt with a similar finish.

Poured from a. 750 ml bottle into a trappist glass. The color is brown with reddish tinge, aroma is light not overly spice laden, small head, some tang followed by sweetness and a residual spice finish with the warmth of the alcohol

.75 bottle. Brown. Dark musty, plummy spicy cinnamon, dark bread, syrupy nose. Full bodied, soft, nice smooth mouthpfeel. Dark bread, some dark fruits, cinnamon, some clove. Really nice smooth xmas beer. Not overly spiced though, but well enough to make a difference.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Light brown colour with a big tan head.
Aroma: Malt, spices, dark fruit, plum.
Body: Medium body, high carbonation.
Flavour: Dark fruit, spices, malt, caramel, plum.

For a Xmas ale it's good. Nice brew on a cold day. Doesn't have that warming feeling in the gut so it's pretty light. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cola colored pour with red-amber hues. Nose of soft toasted malt, plum, faint cherry, and spice. Flavor is plum, dark cherry, toasted malt, and powdery cocoa in the finish. Well-attenuated. Spot on.

Bottled 750ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Dark brown coloured, big beige head, mild alcohol and spices in the nose. Moderate sweet malty, quite fruity and slight alcoholic with lots of spices and prunes. Also some alcohol in the finish. Really nice one.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 75cl shared in a Delirium Noel glass. Pours a nice dark brown with an off white head which lasts well and clings to the glass. Aroma is ABT with added Christmassy notes. Christmas cake, spices complemented by the standard St. Bernardus balance of malts, fruitiness and yeast. Sweetness is perfectly balanced by the slight bitterness in taste. Mouthfeel is medium to full with a good level of carbonation.

Dark brown almost muddy pour tall soapy light tan head. Spiced aroma a bit if a vegative component some clove a good amount of sweetness. Palate is aggressively carbonated well coated finishes smooth. Flavor is a bit sweeter than the aroma. Good stuff.

Argh, I shouldve waited and tried to score the 1000th rating. 990 will do though. Huge thanks to Ogi for getting this! Poured a misty brown-amber body, almost a gusher, slightly off white head. Complex fruity and malty aroma, apricots/peaches, apples, slightly dusty, slightly sweet, overall lovely. Taste.... sweet, malty, light bubblegum, full taste supported by a light tartness - and supported well! Some banana too and very, very light mint. Another damn nice beer from this brewery, tasty, complex, drinkable - a winner!

Prawdziwe arcydzielo. Kolejny raz jestem zadowolony z jakosci i smaku piw z tego browaru. Wyglad ideal. Wspaniala wielka puszystsa i trwala piana zapach typowo swiateczny, gozdziki, cynamon troche sliwek i zwlaszcza daktyle. W smaku truflowo sliwkowe, jakby babcine powidla z dodatkiem niewielkiej ilosci cukru. Kolor intensywnie ciemno brazowy. No a metnosc na super poziomie, spora i oblepiajaca dno butelki 0,75cl. Korek zagrzmial glosno, dymek spory poszedl no i spore wysyceie jak to w dobrych belgijskich ale. Nic tylko polecac na swieta zwlaszcza.

A decent drink. A little too bubble gum sweet for me. Disappointed really. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a very very dark brown with a white head. Yeasty smell with a hint of sweetness. Nicely spiced taste with nice amounts of alcohol.

The aroma of yeast and alcohol. Rich, fruity, very yeast and a lot of alcohol taste. The aftertaste is left long in the upper part of the mouth. No beer for me. But okay to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
750ml bottle. A nice rich belgian ale. Some fruity flavours, roasty, deep sweet ones. Caramel and spicy aromas. Pours dark copper, hazy, with frothy tan head. Enjoyable.
Dark reddish brown with a thick tan head. Malty and spicy tones. Malt, spices, fruit and caramel. Full body with a balanced, warming finish.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark brown body, with big, stable, creamy, white head. Complex, sweet aroma of yeast, bubblegum, banana, dark fruits, marzipan, christmas spices, some roastyness. Taste with generelly the same aromas, also very complex and sweet, with a more present raisin. Full creamy mouthfeel, with a strong carbonation and a sweet, slightly sour and alcohol warming finish. Tasty! Although there is a lot of sweetness, its still greatly balanced, complex and releases more and more aromas the warmer it gets. Great winter beer!

Flasche (75 cl, 1 Jahr gelagert). - Tiefes Rotbraun. Der Antrunk ist für ein Bier dieser Stärke unerwartet schlank und keß fruchtig, mit gutem Röstmalz und süßsaurer Fruchtigkeit; Noten von Lakritz. Samtiges Mundgefühl, etwas zu rezent. Deutlich hervortretende Gewürze, die an Lebkuchen erinnern. Der hohe Alkoholanteil ist harmonisch eingebunden. Im Abgang krautige Gewürznote, leicht kühlend-mentholartig (Anis?); nur leichte holzige Bittere. - Für meinen Geschmack etwas zu stark gewürztes Weihnachtsbier. Die anderen St.-Bernardus-Biere gefallen mir besser.

Sweet cloying malt heavy flavor, with cherries and bubblegum.  Lots of carbonation. Some cinnamon and hints other Holidays-esque spices. Fluffy eggshell foam with murky brown color to liquid. ABV is evident and leaves a nice warmth as an aftertaste.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark cloudy brown with a huge beige head with tons of lacing. Highly carbonated. Aroma of dark fruits, spices. Taste is sweet malt dominant with cinnamon spiciness. Caramel, roasted malt, plums and raisin notes. Sticky mouthfeel, medium to full bodied. Very good Xmas ale as could be expected from St Bernadus.

Poured dark brown with a frothy off white head. Aroma of light spice, caramel malt and dark fruit. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, candy sweetness, plum and berries.

31st December 2013Very dark brown beer, good cream coloured head. Palate is airy and mildly crisp. Airy dry malt cream. Spice. Tangy dark fruits underneath. Spicy bubblegum. Finishes semi dry with a spicy linger. Fine.
Smaller bottle. Brown opaque pour with a thick frothy off white head. Aroma of spices, Belgian yeast and brown sugar. Medium body, plenty of carbonation with a sticky sweet finish. Wonderful.

Dark body with a khaki head. The aroma is mostly anise, with some candi sugar, and faint ginger and subdued orange peel. The flavor is much the same, with the anise in the forefront. Abundant lacing, well hidden alcohol, and very "digestible". Too strong on the anise, although I would prefer none at all. Not as good as I had expected.

Bottle as a Christmas present from brother. Nice brownish red pour. Aroma of dried fruits (cherries and prunes). Flavor is too sweet at first, but as you continue drinking flavor becomes more bitter and the flavor of alcohol comes through pretty significantly. Body is relatively light and level of carbonation is medium. I like the St. Bernardus 12 a ton, but as of now, I am unsure of how much I like this beer.

Sweet sugar and a bit of fruit to the aroma. Well, this is certainly a sweet Belgian, without any of the Christmas flavors youd expect from a non-Belgian Christmas ale. Its good, but many of these Belgian strongs are starting to taste the same to me.

From tap into goblet. Brown with some haze. Creamy head that lasts and lasts. Taste is very of a smooth full body malt that is slightly sweet with a hint of pine/fir and a wispy hint of alcohol. Very very good.

750ml corked bottle 
Good big loud pop on opening. Brilliant looking beer; murky mahogany body with a dense creamy white head, painting the glass with thick lace.
Rich aroma, cake-like, though I wouldnt say Christmas cake; treacle, toasted nuts, dried fig and sultana, light cinnamon and nutmeg spice.
Body is thick, nice creamy carbonation, lingers long on the palate, mouth-coating.
More cakey flavours continue on the body; rich caramels, dried fruits, cocoa, plums, woody spices. Warming finish, subdued carbonation, decidedly sweet overall.
Hung onto this one for over a year, certainly seems to have held up well. Tasty treat... Merry Christmas!

Enjoying on Christmas Eve as I watch A Christmas Story and wrap gifts while the family sleeps. A wonderful strong ale that has a hint of mulling spices. Floats on the palette, lighter than one would expect, with an impressive complexity. Well done.

Draught at rosamund bk. Pours unclear medium brown with a nice soft dense lasting head and some lace. Aroma is deep fruity, malty, cocoa, dusty earth. From tap @ kerstbierfestival Essen. Dark brown muddy pour with a well sized beige head. Fantastic smell of fruits and dried fruits. I really get the christmas spices in there. Cinnamon and licorice. Nice flavor of the licorice and dark heavy malts. Again the lovely raisins / plums, slightly alcoholic linger. Like what can be expected from St Bernardus it has a great thick and full body with the perfect amount of carbonation. Very happy to have had the chance to taste this.

Draft at Monks. Pours a deep reddish-brown with thin beige head. Nose of fig, dark fruits, spice, vanilla, slightly bready. Sweet and malty. Medium to full body. Slightly warming but no alcohol notes in the aroma or taste.

330 ml bottle, 2013 vintage - cellar temperature. clear deep amber with a long lasting fine head. Spicy nose, typical for the Belgian xmas ales: cloves and cardamom, slight malt and caramel touch. Medium body with high alcohol burn due to low comparable body and thickness. Herbal taste and too much green flavours. With a bit more Sugar and body this would have been a great winter warmer.

Aroma: Dark fruit, molasses, a bit of spice. Typical for a Belgian Christmas style.

Appearance: Burgundy, head dissipates in seconds. Leaves a bit of lacing though.

Taste: Apples, plums, lots of pie spice. Deep, but with distinct character. Still reminiscent of most Belgian xmases Ive had.

Palate: surprisingly light, though with plenty of sticky fruit and hearty spice. Not to heavy, well balanced for the night spent avoiding sleet in the abnormally precipitous New York evening.


Overall: Solid. Belgian. Winter ale. Nothing more, nothing less. Looking for a baseline winter belg you found it. Nothing stands out, but everything is solid. Built like a rock, this beer is.

11.2 oz bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with huge tan head. I must have given it a shake, though I didnt mean to. It ran over. Maybe it was hugely carbonated. Not sure. Lovely fruity aroma. Tastes the same. I cant identify the spices, if any, but its subtly different from the Abt 12. Medium mouthfeel. Full carbonation. Excellent beer.

Tap at the t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Poured a dark almost mahogany colour with a huge frothy light tan head. The aroma is Belgian yeast, sweet caramel and malt. The flavour is medium bitter slightly sweet with a liqourice red berry fruit palate and a long bitter slightly medicinal finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. A nice Christmas beer from St Bernardus. I would have preferred a slightly sweeter beer but I understand that isnt to everyones taste.

Draft. Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, licorice, caramel, overripe dark fruit, booze and alcohol. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Cant believe I have never had this. Shared with EricTeusink. Comes of just like there delicious quad with spices. 330ml bottle shared with jeevan, from Appelation Wines Dalry. Pours dark reddish brown with a big off-white head. Very sweet smell. Kind of like bubble gum. Nice shiny brown pour. Awesome taste. Sweet, malty, caramel, and bananas. Very fine beer.

The aroma is a very interesting blend of caramel malts, roasted malts, and earthy hops. The appearance is a murky orangeish brown color with a large white head that fades to a ring. The taste blends a heavy umami, slight sourness, and a mild sweetness, and the palate combines a medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, and a finish that keeps the umami on your tongue and reminds me of coffee (without the bitterness).

On tap at Global Brew. Pours a dark opaque brown with a decent light tan head. Vinous and spice aroma. Taste is sweet roasted malt, dark fruit, molasses and a bit of wild yeast funk that is a nice addition. Smooth and delicious.
Tap at mikkeller bar, san francisco. Deep brown color, white head. Aroma is belgian style sweetness, spices, lemon notes, raisin. Balanced taste, raisin, spices, sweet malts.
On tap at Black Bottle Brewery. Brown and cloudy with a light tan head. Aroma and flavor of spices, cinnamon, fruity esters and Belgian yeast. Full body with a creamy feel and soft carbonation.

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden. Pours hazy, brown-reddish with a three finger high beige foam that leaves lacing on the glass. 
Nose: Belgian yeast, spice, fried fruit, plum, banana and fresch apples. 
Taste: Syrup, dried fruit, dark malt, chocolate, spice, raisin, coffee and bread - Really good! 
Medium, complex body with a great carbonation and a very good job on hiding the alcohol. Tasty with a sweetnes that ends with a lillte bitternes - Great!

Draft - Toffee, toasted malts, raisin, plum and orange spice. Cloudy brown with a rich beige head. Brown sugar, date, ginger and slight sourness. A little light on the palate, but nice.
Probably my favorite holiday beer. Tastes kind of like the abt 12 with cherries. A better version of mad elf.
Cerveza abbey ale con cuerpo, oscura, y alto porcentaje en alcohol pero no fuerte de sabor

From the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle. The pour is brown to ruby red with a huge fluffy beige head that lingers a long time. The aromas are of dark malts, breaded malts, Belgian sugar, mild spice, dark fruit, plum, and a little alcohol. Medium body. The flavor is similar with dark fruit, molasses, raisins, and a bitter hop bite at the end. Some alcohol burn.
Dark brown color with large tan head. Aroma and flavor have nice strong malts, spices, and deep rich fruit and vinous notes. Cmplex and full bodied, yet balanced and very drinkable.

While subtle, the aroma is inviting. Belgian yeast with hints of citrus, fruit, and a lovely funk. A thin tan head producing no lacing, sits atop a dark amber pour. The taste is overall slightly sweet, but very pleasing. Flavors of Belgian yeast, candy sugar, and fruit prevail. A touch of grain and alcohol are noted in the finish and aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. A nice oily mouthfeel. Overall, I enjoyed this beer (its a nice sipper by the fireplace!) and look forward to its appearance next year.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 2013: 750ml: Nose is bread, a touch of lemonade, candy sugar, orange, slight mint and herbs. Taste bread, some dark fruits, figs, leading to malt, orange, coco, a little licorice and smoke, with herb and slight pepper finish. Wears its abv very lightly. mouthfeel is rich.

Complex and delicious festive beer.


2014: 330ml. First time I have seen this in a smaller bottle. 
 Nose is pronounced ginger, cloves, yeast, cinnamon, spice, plums, figs. Taste is ginger, mint leading to a strong spice, malt, orange, light coco, a little cream, dark fruits. The smaller bottle is over carbonated which detracts from the beer a surprising amount. .

The 2014 (at least in the smaller bottle) is a weaker beer than last year, I dont care for the more pronounced ginger, and its just to fizzy. Still a 3.8 or 3.9 - the rating for the 2013 stands.

Shared from a corked big brown bottle into a tulip glass. It poured a hazy deep reddish brown colour with huge beige head of spritzy little bubbles, everlasting with sheets of pretty Belgian lace. Aromas of risign bread dough, sour lemonade, black pepper, clove. Bready flavours too, sourdough, crisp grains, toast, with firm hoppy bitterness. Hints of raisins, dried cranberries and cherries. Toffee, sticky pudding, boozy fruitcake. Some definite tartness, with a bright port wine or coffee-like acidity. Hints of harmonious holiday spices: nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, clove, though those could be entirely from the yeast. Light body but well-rounded mouthfeel, intense carbonation, long-lasting bittersweet aftertastes. Complex and delicious.

Dark brown pour with a massive head with excellent lacing that lasts forever. Nose is of dark fruit, raisins and dates, against a malt backbone with a hint of spice. Light medium body and very well carbonated. Alcohol is well hidden with dark fruit and malt flavors. Spice is present, but subdued. Clean finish with a slight alcoholic bitterness. Not as flavorful or smooth as Gouden Carolus Noel, which in my opinion, is the best of the Belgian Christmas ales.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours brown with a tan head. Taste dark fruits, lightly sweet, boozy. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

Bottle: Dark brown color, brownish head, Aroma is light sourly, light fruity and light spicy. Flavor is full of christmas spices, mulled wine, red wine. Bitter dry finish.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a dark brown with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma of yeast and dark fruit. Taste of strong yeast and hints of booze.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 75cl bottle. Sweet and spicy aroma with hints of fruits and yeast. High carbonation, kind of like a chimay. Really refreshing even though it is sweet as well. Quite boozy with tastes of dates, a hint of cherries and a lot of spices. Great palate with a nice balance.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Trappiste chalice. Pours a deep brown with a reddish hue. Very thick, fluffy white head. Head lasted like it was a nitro pour. Aroma of dark breads, cereal, sweet dark candies, Belgian yeasts, and dark fruits. Also some spices. The taste was similar with the bread and sweet candies mostly and then the spices and booziness come in at the finish. Creamy, soft and relaxing for the palette. Medium carbonation, full body. Great winter beer.
Very nice quad style beer. Very fruity and nice and sweet. Would like to try the larger bottle.

(bottle, 33cl) Dark brown colour with a ruby shine and a big and tanned foamy head. Fruit-accented and mildly toasted malty aroma with notes of Christmas spices and vinous hints of dried fruits. Sweet and delicately bitter flavour, almost full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Dark malty taste with slightly vinous fruity notes of dried cranberries, cherries and plums, as well as a present spicy touch, including notes of cinnamon and other x-mas spices; sweet and delicately bitter toast-malty finish with balanced spicy notes and a well-embedded alcoholic strength. Deserves the name Christmas Ale. 23.XI.13

Fresh small (33cl) bottle from Save On. Dark brown with everlasting flat dense head and lace. Herbal spicy aroma with some dark fruit and a little alcohol. Fresh dark fruit complex sweetness with licorice and herbal bitterness with some lingering herbal caramel and tobacco. Medium (not too full) body and effervescent carbo. So fucking excellent. Merry fucking Christmas.

On tap at Roscoes in Portland, OR. Colour...dark amber with no head. Nose...dried dark fruits, grape skins, crushed cherries. Palate...tangy up front with macerated currants, fig paste, marzipan and kirschwasser. Theres plenty of booze and the finish is lengthy and fruity.

On draught at roscoes 2011 - pours clear dark amber. Nose of booze, cherry, grape, and malt. Taste of warming booze, cherry, and yeast.

Bottle from Belgium in a box; cloudy brown pour with beige head, rich Christmas pudding aroma, taste has raisins, dried fruits, some xmas spices nutmeg and cinnamon, dusty yeast and dark fruits.

Bottle. Murky medium orange-brown body, thick puffy cream head. Leathery nose, lots of spice and dark fruit and bready, doughy esters. Spicy, sharply carbonated body with toasted sugars, clove, and bubblegum. Lots of green apple peel. Nice and estery and unsurprisingly excellent.

Bottle, Systembolaget. 

Slightly hazy dark amber with a white head. Rather sweet aroma and taste of dried fruit, light spices, apples, marzipan and nuts. A full body on this one and some warming alcohol in the finish. I wonder how well this one will age? For sure a pleasant winter warmer.
Draught at Akkurat. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with caramel, spices, toffee, malts and cookie dough. Bittersweet finish with malts, citrus and spices. Excellent belgian strong.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2014 Bottle: deep brown body with ruby red highlights; murky, opaque, & topped off with a thick, fluffy, creamy, long-lasting beige foam. Aroma is perplexing, containing notes of wine-like, vinous grapes, phenol, apple skins, berries, dark prunes, clove, some rotten banana, baked bread, toffee, & perhaps some molasses. Sweet & malty to the core. Taste is even more complex & more spiced... Nutmeg, anise, & ginger are present now, also with tiny bits of cinnamon & white pepper. Cocoa powder in the finish; bread, toffee, earth, figs, apples, plums, booze, & a finishing, rye-like dryness. Lots going on here, & its certainly a " big" beer, but I love to sip on it. Lovely holiday ale.

Classic deep brown St. Bernardus pour. Thick khaki head. Yeast, dried fruit, and spice on the nose. Well balanced flavor. Belgian yeast, dark fruit, sweet malt, hints of ginger and nutmeg. Nice little holiday bouquet. Well hidden booze, but just enough to warm. Proper.

Pours dark brown with low frothy tan head. Aroma of spices, yeast, coriander, brown sugar, malts. Taste is sweet vanilla and cream, light spices especially towards the finish, mild bitterness. Alcohol hidden well. Body is medium to full and creamy.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Pours very dark brown with a massive frothy tan head. Aromas of molasses, spices, roasted malts, chocolate, roasted nuts, orange zest. Taste is sweet and vinous with medium body and prominent carbonation
Brown sugar, dried fruit, Belgian yeast, some spiciness, and a bit of alcohol at the end. Very festive (not in a gay way), an excellent beer for Christmas.

Pours reddish brown with a monster frothy white monster of a head. Aroma is decadent with notes of cinnamon, dried stone fruits, yeast, and christmas cheer. Flavor is moderately to heavy sweet, complex, full body. Warm finish from the booze makes this a winner for a Friday night happy hour by a fire.

330cl bottle purchased at The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma on this is classic St. Bernardus. Plums, raisins, and figs. A hint of molasses and brown sugar is also present. Light dusty yeast esters, too. As it warms, ginger and gingerbread cookies come in big. Nicely aromatic. Mostly opaque mahogany body present. With a medium, fizzy, khaki head. Fairly quickly dissipating. Starts pretty carbonated and spritzy. Becomes a little sweet and fruity with some caramelly, burnt malts in the middle. Becomes a little spicy with perhaps some ginger later on. A little bit of a dry finish, and just generally a little drier than I like.
Flaske, 75 cl. Mørk mahogny. Hvidt skum. Nødder. Alkohol. Marcipan. Kanel, figner. Pudsig note af legetøjs-ler fra Fætter BR. Stor kropsfylde. Brændende fornemmelse på tungen.

I'm a big fan of Christmas ales, but this is my first Belgian in this style. All the requisite notes are there, but with a super nice infusion of quad-like dark fruits and Belgian yeast. Surprisingly crisp mouthfeel, but maybe a tad too much ABV coming through. B+

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at delirium - received as a gift , thnx staff ! 
Pours dark brown , good white foam 
No real smell 
Soft carbo 
Minty chocolate ( didnt see that one coming ) not like most other christmas beers ( plain sweet ) but actualy pretty refreshing ( mint ???) 
Very unique ! Has got a soda like - component to it. Chemical comes to mind , but than again , if st bernardus is chemical , than what isnt ? 
Weird , unique and diffrent !

from tap @ Delirium. Dark brown, thick full white head. Some anice, a lot of yeast, malts, dried fruit, caramel in the nose. Taste is herbal, candi sugar, even slightly punchy. Sweet finish, good carbonation, overall a nice winterbeer.

Just phenomenal. The Blegians really know how to brew a christmas ale - everything about the flavor character here is quintessentially christmas, and one of the most warming, comforting beers youll drink. Theres no syrupy texture, no nauseating cinnamon, just expertly balanced flavors like nutmeg and dried fruits that blend together to create something unique and beautiful. Dont pass up any chance to enjoy this. 

However, IMO, Affligem Noel is a similar but slightly better version of this style of ale.

Bottle at home. 
Sweet nose, prunes. 
Hazy light brown, white head. 
Medium to full body, sweet , raisins, fruit. 



:)
Bolton Brew.
So this everything good in life wrapped up in a bottle. Aromas of banana bread, bubblegum, dark fruits, and yeast. Flavors are nutmeg, banana, dark fruits, bread and hops. Excellent.

corked and caged bottle split with the wife. pours medium tan amber, ample cream colored head that leaves an impressive lacing pattern. nose of burnt sugar, pitted fruits, toast. taste begins with toast that lightly transforms to sweet cherries, plums. finish has some burn. body is big, but mouthfeel is creamy.

Nice strong ale. There were a lot of fruity notes on the aroma. Caramel brown color with a white head and good lacing. Creamy palate and above average weight with good carbonation. More fruit esters and some sour points with a strong maltiness finished with Belgian yeast. Very nice and the alcohol was covered well.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Bu en bouteille de 75cl, un tein très brunâtre et presque pas de mousse, en bouche on sent pour commencer les notes grillées très présentes et ensuite arrive les épices, mais ce qui est génial cest que cest très délicat très fin très bon tout simplement

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 33cl bottle into glass. Lille. 

Appearance: chocolate brown, not a very deep tint. Generous off white head. 

Aroma: raisin, dried fruit, malted barley, nutmeg, ginger. 

Taste: sweet then small amount of hops. 

Palate: full body, thick texture, low carbonation. 

Overall: my second time drinking this ale. a nice Christmas beer . A great base with nice spice notes in the nose and finish. Really is a great beer for the holidays.

A: HUGE HEAD, Dark Brown hue, Great Lacing

S: Dark Fruit, Molasses, Sweet Malts

T: Malty, Molasses, Dark Fruits (Raisins and Plums), Slightly Boozy

M: Well Carbonated, Medium Bodied, Sweet, Dry

Overal, a great beer with a nice balance to it, slightly boozy.

Bottle, Dark and pored with a big head which took a long time to dissipate,
Not as much body strength as I had anticipated. Looked forward to trying this one but in all honesty it was a bit disappointing.

Aroma of spice, pumpkin pie. Deep ruby red appearance. Taste of spice, equal to the aroma tasting like pumpkin pie, and cider. Light bitter aftertaste. Very fitting Halloween/Christmas season beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Color caoba oscuro con espuma color crema generosa. Aromas de malta, frutos rojos acidos. En boca es sedosa con un inicio ligeramente dulce enseguida invadido por una acidez intensamente afrutada, muy equilibrada y agradable. El alcohol ni se nota. Una delicia.

Can taste raisin and figs. Alcohol taste is heavy as well, like brandy perhaps. Very malty, little to no hop presence. Huge body and tons of carbonation. Very lively and strong brew with a velvet like texture. Only minor complaint would be that its almost too bubbly and it gets in the way of the flavors.

Bomber in Tallahassee. Like the abt 12 better. Strong alcohol finish. Overall a great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had bomber with Erik at fermentation lounge in Tallahassee. Reminds me of holy sheet, very malty brown beer with oak flavors tastes like it was aged in a whiskey barrel. Good for its kind.
Aroma of brown sugar and banana. Finish has a strong alcohol note which is to be expected with the alcohol content

Review from 11/23/12.

Pours dark brown with medium off-white colored head. Aroma is banana, spice, yeast, and malt. Taste is sweet with a mild bitter finish. Mouthfeel is medium thick, a little syrupy, but appropriate for this style. Overall good and the spiciness gives it a nice holiday feel. :)

Dark amber colour with amber head. Lots of spices, fruits which linger at the back of the palette. Perfect winter beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oh merveille des merveilles, grandeur des grandeurs, merveille des grandeurs, grandeur des
merveilles  Attention chef doeuvre !!!
Bouteille de 75 cl à 10 % abv... beau programme !!!
Couleur entre noir et roux très foncé.
Clarté très opaque. Bulles assez grosses mais vraiment très nombreuses, partout dans le verre,
et très vives. Mousse beige, café crème, soyeuse au centre et à flocons au bord.
Arômes vineux, fruits confits, fruits mûrs, avec une pointe dépices orientales.
1ère bouche soyeuse sur du très grand bourgogne rouge, style clos Vougeot, je ne vous dirai pas quelle parcelle, mais un indice : de là on peut voir la Romanée Conti 
Cette bouche présente un liant superbe et des épices. Larrière-bouche est sublime, elle offre
tout en même temps : pain complet, vin, lie, fruits nobles, malt, etc.
2ème bouche avec des nuances au-delà du dicible, avec une pointe de lavande, de la cannelle,
du thym et du romarin.
3ème nez avec une pointe danis délicate. 
3ème bouche à la texture veloutée, avec une pointe fine de noix, noisette, amande.
Arrière-bouche complète, fine et très complexe.
Longueur splendide, forte et élégante.
Levure comme de la soie, pure, avec des côtés aromatiques uniques.
Alcool progressif, qui fait un gros travail darrière-fond et soutient lensemble de larchitecture.
Finale : un grand sommet, de lart pur.
Conclusion : on a tout ici dans ce verre, depuis le velouté en passant par les céréales, les épices,
la levure, le houblon, etc etc. Cette bière est dans le sens propre du terme « capiteuse », et elle
est digne des plus grands vins français. Nous en avons cité deux en début de critique, mais il 
y en aurait beaucoup dautres. (Je lai dégustée dailleurs un 14 juillet pour bien montrer que
la Belgique nest aucunement inférieure pour la dégustation de grands crus Quon se le dise,
citoyens ...)
Un sommet du brassage, tout comme sa sur lAbt. 
(Encore une fois, merci aux membres de ratebeer, pour me permettre le premier 5 de cette
bière sur 848 votes !!! Incroyable mais vrai !!! En fait, cette bière mérite cent fois le 5, cest-
à-dire 500 sur 100. Cote minimale bien entendu, et donnée à froid, 2 jours après dégustation .)

On tap last Christmas. Clear ruby black color with rich light tan colored foam. Nice dark raison, holiday spice, belgian spice, earthy caramel aromas. medium body, soft carbonation. Rootbeer, spicy yeast flavors with dark raisons, caramel----very tasty on tap.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Appearance: Dark ruby/copper, clear with 3+ finger thick billowing tan, tight bubble head.
Aroma: Stewed sourness of prunes, vinous, dried figs, orange, hint of banana, fruit cake, pepper, star anise, pine, slightly yogurty and bubblegum.
Taste: Vinous/cognac, banana, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, and medium sourness.
Palate: Smooth texture, medium body (strangely mouthfeel is very light and airy), initially creamy, prickly to high carbonation, very strong alcohol warmth that lingers on the tongue to such an extent that its like I have just eaten a chilli, lingering heat and astringency. Thank-fully a long finish!
Comments: Lovely. Glad it was large bottle, but writing this and wishing I had another! Left a glass lace. I will certainly be getting more of this one.

A - Burgundy brown, with a fluffy tan head that forms a nice bubbly collar.

S - Sweet and tangy fruit, plums cherries, clove and cinnamon, apples.

T - Brown sugar, clove, cinnamon, dark plums, dried figs, apples, candy sugar, cherries, brown spice cake, anise, some light hop and peppery alcohol on back end. The aftertaste leaves glazed plantains on the palate.

M - Moderate carbonation, medium body, light on the tongue.

A perfect Christmas beer! Sweet and spicy upfront and dry and satisfying on the finish.

Serving type: bottle

12-26-2011

A - Dark ruby-black with a big finger of frothy dark khaki head. Fades slowly.

S - Sweet dark caramel malts, dark fruits, Belgian yeast, clove, coriander, pepper, other spices, candi sugar, booze.

T - Sweet dark caramel malts, raisin and other dark fruits, Belgian yeast, clove, coriander, pepper, other spices, candi sugars, some booze.

M - Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a warming, sweet, and lightly spicy finish.

D - Great balanced Quad. Good mix of yeast and malt flavors.
December 2010. From a 750 ml. bottle. Pours dark brown. Lots of spices, brown sugar and dried fruit aromas. Awesome seasonal beer.

0.75l corked bottle from Etrè. This is a deep brown one, almost what you might call a bit murky in color and it has a medium sized somewhat fading light brown top that clings to the sides of the glass. On the nose I get a strong and powerful Im-Belgian expression. Tons of that Belgian yeast with alcohol and candied dark sugar. There are spices in this also; I get cloves and cardamon mainly. Some chocolate paper traces also present. Quite nice. Its somewhat lively - and again "Belgian" on the carbonation this, and it has a nice gliding-oily mouthfeel. Up on the taste I get licorice, Belgian yeast, alcohol, dark burned syrup. Its also kinda peppery and spiced with more cardamon and cloves, and it has a subtle but most definitely present acidity-sourness that gives it a new twist. Ends with even more licorice and a gentle but present nice alco-burn in the aftertaste. Ho-Ho! Im getting in that nice Christmas mood while/after drinking this! 25.11.2012

Thank you Jesus for this beer.  A little late on delivering this to my door, but a good Christian will forgive you.  Does the monks finger, and his happy demeanor concern anyone else?  And the beer is good too.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours dark brown in color with a thick creamy tan head. Sweet darker fruits as plums, raisins and dadels in flavor. Some dough and dark bready notes as well. Sweet malty, slightly vinous notes, some dough and them darker fruits again are apparent in the taste. Pretty heavy with some dark sweet fruity influences.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 750 bottle on a cold wintery night.  Pours dark reddish brown with fine lacing.  Dark fruits with spices in the nose.  Nutmeg, clove spices that blend well with the dark fruit and malts.  Well carbonated lively palate.  Very warming finish.  Damn good beer tonight.  This is a well balanced full flavored beer.  First rate March 2013.  Been drinking it much longer.  Just up the score, its that good.

This seems just a tad lighter than the Abt 12 but very similar. Not a bad thing! Pours dark brown, aromas of dried fruit, brown sugar, and spices. Really complex aroma. Flavor follows suit, very rich and complex. Long finish. Impressive beer, definitely something I could drink every holiday season.

13/07/09 750ml corked bottle i got at dalhouise co-op

A dark brown with some ufos

S quite nice some raisins booze and lots of spice,

T also quite nice yeast, bread and yes lots of spice, raisins, and nutmeg sits heavy booze is there but would not guess 10%

M thick but not creamy nor chewey, good carbonation, Solid overall

D not the best day for drinking, "summer" night in calgary would have been better as a winter warmer (DUH)

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle set on the counter for half an hour and then poured into a trappist glass.  Pours tranlucent dark/medium brown with small beige head which dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, medium/thick body, well carbonated, and light dark fruit aroma.  Taste is dark candy sugar, some honey, some booze, and some dark fruit (mostly raisin).  This is sweet, a little hard to drink, and pretty close to St. Bernardus 12.

Sample from 75cl bottle @ BrugsBierFestival 03/02/2013. - slightly distracted by animated talk with the brewer at the stand, but as far as I remember this was just as rich and somewhat sweeter and spicier than regular Bernardus 12, which in turn is even smoother and more elegant. Expertly brewed, no apparent alcohol whatsoever.
Brown pour beige head. Caramel and spice. Incredibly smooth strong ale. Surprisingly thin body and a rad oaky but damn its good
Aroma of iron, golden raisins, and spice.  Pours red brown with a big pink head.  Taste is delightfully Belgian.  Dates, molasses and slight iron.

Clear brown pour, but the beer turned cloudy in the cup.  Nice head lingers fo a while.  Malt and spice aroma.  Raisin bread and spices, fading to a pleasant alcohol burn that dissolves into sweetness.

8oz pour at Paradiso Georgetown.  Translucent amber with some soft white head.  Nose is very fruity, plums, raisins, pear, candy sugar, clove.  Flavor is sweet, malty, a little hit of cinnamon, plum, fruit cake, dried cherries, raisins, candy sugar.  Full, sweet finish.

750 ml bottle. This is a very mellow belgian. It has a mild xmas spice flavor. Many xmas ales have crisp spice flavors but this one is very mellow. Much like the St. Bernardus tripel, the flavors are very mellow with a strong alcohol content that is masked perfectly behind the drinkable style. This is a great beer, it isnt as good as the St. Bernardus ABT 12, but if you enjoy XMAS ales and the ABT12 you will enjoy this. Flavors I get are, nutmeg, clove, and yeast with a strong banana aroma. Ive actually never seriously smelled a banana aroma until this beer. GOOD STUFF. DRINK. IT. TRUST. ME.

Older bottle, not sure how old but its gathered some dust over the years.  Really nice mahogany copper color.   Age has hurt the head potential here.  Rich malty nose, some dark fruit and slight alcohol present.  Alcohol burn up front is distracting as is prickly carbonation.  Malt flavor and body are big here but Im still struggling with.  Tobacco, cocoa flavors, a bit yeasty/bready flavor round things out a bit.  I feel the handling of this bottle (sub optimal) has lead to some deficiencies.  Id certainly welcome the opportunity to try this again as this is no fly by the night brewery.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 75 cl bottle. This is a pleasure and a treat. Dark brown color, cloudy liquid, and nice beige frothy head. The aroma is very good. Very malty: hints of caramel, licorice, chocolate and yeast. The taste is great, very complex, although a little overwhelmed by the carbonation. Full body, creamy/thick texture and lively carbonation. Maybe the weakest point of this brew is the high carbonation, but I think that it is not over-the-top. The finish is smooth and very long, with slight alcoholic notes. A great beer, to warm you and uplift your spirit during the long winter.

Aroma has candied syrup, toffee, caramel, is a touch yeasty. Appearance is a deep brown, transparent, touch opaque, off-white, almost fawn head. Taste is a nice caramel, toffee, hints of chocolate. Palate is nice, good mouthfeel, touch bitter, but good.

On tap pours a hazy brown with a thick head. Aroma of brown sugar and banana. Finish has a strong alcohol note which is to be expected with the alcohol content. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy brown with good head and lacing.   Aroma of banana with some funk and spice.  Same on taste with only slight bitter and some brown sugar.  Highly carbonated with moderate mouthfeel.  Carbonation maybe a bit much but very good beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

St. Bernardus Christmas Ale is a big beer at 10% and not a bad representation of the style.  The pour produces a big almost too risky head.  The aroma is very pleasant fruity.  Sour flavors dominate but the flavor is well-balanced overall.  Christmas Ale is a tasty beer for the cooler months.

Pours medium brown, strong iced tea color with small tan head.  Aroma is banana with some spice and a little funk.  Taste is like a spicy banana bread with a little barnyard funk and slight alcohol taste at the end.  Flavors mix very well and is highly carbonated.   Mouthfeel is full and pleasant. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Dark reddish brown in appearance with an impressive layer of thick beige foam and lots of active carbonation trails. The aroma is a blend of caramelized sugars, figs, pears, yeast and panettone. The flavor offers up a healthy serving of toffee, toasted malt, raisins and black cherries in addition to some cinnamon, Belgian yeast and candi sugar notes. Also a moderate alcohol presence in the background that helps to keep the massive flavors in check. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and creamy with naturally strong carbonation while the finish brings a final dose of caramel, malt and holiday spices. Overall, an exceptionally tasty brew to celebrate the holidays with.

Very nice. First thought was a less sweet Samichlaus. Brown pour with a little red. White short lived head with a lot of lacing. Musty sweet aroma. Enjoyable, but I wont spend the evening sniffing it. Taste is similar to aroma but with faint molasses and fruit. Love it.
On tap. The aroma is heaven. Fruit and wheat and sugar.  Really a nice abbey, fruity, molasses flavor with apricot and (unfortunately) some licorice.  Ends a bit medicine like, but great overall.

Dark ruby almost chestnut pour with a frothy beige head that quickly vanishes. Aroma: caramel, raisin, leafy, hops, malt, banana peel. Mouthfeel and taste: very high carbonation with a warming alcohol warmth. Bitter, sweet and slightly dry. Caramel, hoppy, vinous, raisin, nutty. Superb

Poured from a 750 ml bottle.  Deep, cloudy, nutty brown color.  HUGE, thick, creamy, tan head (4 inches) that lasts and lasts.  Aroma is fruity and complex.  Medium sweet taste and a softer carbonation than Ive been accustomed to with other Belgian beers.  At 10% ABV the alcohol is invisible while drinking.  Very nice.

75 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele into a bowl shaped glass (in several increments).  Dark brown with red highlights, frothy head.  Aromatic, spiced, sweet, fruity.  Smooth, with a hint of fruit and a bit of Christmas pudding.  Has substance and flavour.

Bottle at JF tasting, 2012 Vintage, Noel Cuveliers farm shop - 29/12/12.
Hazed chestnut brown with a good sized frothy off white head that retains well.
Nose is dark fruits, dates, bread, spice, toffee, yeast esters, banana, liqourice, lots going down !
Taste comprises banana, marzipan, dates, spice, toffee, prunes, yeast ester, dark fruits.
Full bodied with fine carbonation, fruity finish.
Well balanced and complex, alcohol is well hidden, one to share amongst friends at 75cl!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750 ml bottle. Pours slightly cloudy dark brown with medium head. Aromas of brown sugar, dark fruit, roasted malts and spice. Very much the same flavors with a bit of toast and marmalade and possibly a hint of cinnamon. Smooth and warm. Very similar to the Abt 12 though a bit thinner.

Pours with a nice rich tan head. Heavy Belgian yeasty aroma with bubble gum and dried fruits.  Taste is like eating a mouthful of Belgian yeast with bread, molasses and dried fruits.   Very creamy with a heavy mouth feel.   This is is a Belgian ale on crack. Would definitely drink again.   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750mL bottle.  Best before:  07/25/17.  A deep reddish plum colored pour with a massive meringue-like beige head.  Candi sugar, caramel, plums, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemons, citrus zest, wheat, and a yeasty tanginess in the aroma.  Medium-bodied and kinda sticky on the way down.  Caramel, candi sugar, bananas, plums, and raisin bread upfront taste-wise.  A yeasty/citrusy tanginess/zestiness at the end.  A moderately dry finish.  Some spiciness (cinnamon & nutmeg) and a fair amount of warming alcohol throughout.  I cant believe I havent rated this before.

Bottle from Beautiful Beers Beer Store, Bury St Edmunds. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Very nice nose of caramel, dates, figs, sultanas and Christmas pudding. Rich, warming flavours of chocolate, dates, prunes and raisins. Bloody nice Christmas ale.

Pours a luxurious hazy brown hue topped with a thick and ever-replenishing tan head, looks great.  Inviting aroma of booze, candied fruits, and a touch of molasses.  Fruity and malty flavors complement each other at first, however I felt the alcoholic heat and boozy notes to undermine the complexity of the brew.  Beautifully effervescent and full bodied on the palate, however I recall enjoying their Abt much more than this offering.

Bottle opened on Christmas eve and shared with family.  The pour is a dark murky brown color with a thick fluffy head that lasts.  Lacing clings to the glass after each sip giving the beer an exceptional appearance.  The aroma has an array of plum, prune, light spice, raisin bread, and yeast.  The flavors tilt a bit on the sweet side of things as its not as spicy as expected.  A lot of Belgian yeasty notes mix with raisin bready flavors, fruity esters, and candi sugar.  Rich in the body and warming in the finish with some gentle alcohol heat.  This isnt as good as their regular version but its not too far off either.

csakajosor.hu
 Sötétbarna színe van, habja bézs színű, vastag, tömör, olyan, mint egy tollpárna, krémes és igen kitartó. Illata sötét aszalt gyümölcsös, fűszeres, belga élesztős, gyógynövényes, medvecukros. Belekóstolva is érzi az ember ezeket az aromákat, amik rendkívül selymesen, finom likőrösen simogatják a nyelvünket, egy kis komlóval és csokis malátakeksszel kiegészítve. Testes, sűrű de nem nehéz és apró buborékokkal van tele és kellemesen bizserget, melegít. Utóíze keserédes, fűszeres. Igazi karácsonyi sör, amivel azért óvatosan kell bánni, mert könnyen elbódít.

750ml bottle.  Pours a deep garnet with a light tan head.  Aroma has dark pit fruit, candied sugar, spice and esthers.  Taste is sweet with a little bit of bitterness.  Very smooth even with some alcohol warmth.  A fantastic Christmas beer!
Dark brown. Big head with lots of lacing. I got mostly earthy type aromas like hay, wheat, harvest. I taste wheat, some fruitiness (esp banana), spices. Complex balanced flavor Great beer.

Bottle 0,75L. Dark mahogany colour, with small light brown head, that turns into a crown quickly. Very fruity nose - strawberry, grape, dried grape, nuts, banana and some earthy notes. A lot of fizzy carbonation and kinda sharp mouthfeel as a result of that carbonation. Mouthfeel is light sweet at the start and turns into moderate bitter aftertaste. Light to medium body with dry texture and fizzy carbonation. Alcohol is somehow hidden, but you can feel it...

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Re-review 11/30/2013 - enjoyed at Stone in Escondito, CA.  Nose and taste are heavily spiced, with molasses and candi sugar notes.  Lots of dried fruit.  Outstanding.  There was a great scent that I couldnt place, but after checking other reviews, it was definitely the nutmeg!  This is one of the best xmas beers Ive had in a while.

Review 12/26/2012 - Tap into a fluted glass. Filled nearly full so head tough to gauge. What little head was allowed to form left thick lacing. Poured a rich mahogany brown. Nose is loaded with spice - cinnamon and nutmeg. Taste is similarly spicy with significant but not overpowering hop bitterness balancing it. Lots of peppery spice on the finish. Bits of molasses and syrup poke through on subsequent sips. Very nice Xmas ale.  (on this tasting, I had given an overall score of 3.8)
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750mL. Nose is rather raisiny and fruity amplified by malty sweetness. Flavor is quite sweet, but of course plenty dry with no hint of cloyingness. Nicely balanced. More straightforward than some of its peers.
Cloudy dark brown appearance. Sweetness of dried fruits and light aniseed. Rich mouthfeel.

Good sized light brown head of fine bubbles that reduce slowly and leave a rocky bit of foam on top.  Excellent carbonaiton as usual from a trappist brew.  Sweet candi sugar in the aroma with some plums, raisins, sweet malts and exquisite belgian yeast.  Color is a deep brown with a hint of red.  Lively in the mouth with more sweet malts, brown sugar, roasted grains, a hint of anise and some cloves.  Noticable alcohol presence and warming.  Slightly oily palate and finish with lingering sweet malts and some more spicy yeast.  Been drinking vraft beers for about 10 years now and have never rated this one but am sure that I have had it on several occasions.  And the best day to be drinking it also.  Merry Christmas!

Poured into a tulip out of a 750ml bottle.

Pours a hazy dark brown with some reddish hues. Billowy tan head with incredible head retention and huge chunks of lacing hanging onto the sides of the glass.

Instant Belgian character on the aroma with clove and banana from the yeast. Brown sugar and some molasses are present along with some toast. Licorice along with a hint of cinnamon, nutmeg, and dark fruits.

Lots of dark fruit in the flavor along with more banana and clove. More brown sugar with strong caramel notes. A very slight bit of tartness on the tip of the tongue. Moderate sweetness that perfectly compliments the other flavors. The finish is moderately dry leaving just the smallest hint of residual sweetness. Alcohol is completely hidden save for a slight bit of warming making this a pleasure to drink.

Overall, this is really one of the best beers I have ever had. Just so much going on and all the flavors and characteristics are perfectly balanced. Dangerously drinkable and one to really savor during the holidays.

Pours a dark ruddy amber with a thick head and minimal lacing.  Smells of spices, raisins, plums, cherries and brown sugar.  Taste is more spices, dark fruits, brown sugar and molasses.  Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation and a dry finish.  Overall a fantastic Christmas ale (my new favorite)! which is a nice alternative to the Abt 12.  Alcohol is well hidden for 10% ABV.  Merry Christmas!

Deep brown pour with a decent head. Smells of banana and fig, cinnamon and yeasty. A little funky sweet, bubbly, fruity banana, with some spices. Not too boozy. Very good. Best Xmas beer I've had thus far. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big Bottle thanks to the in-laws.  Poured a raisin color with two finger head (at least).  Complex aroma of belgium candy, yeast, raisin, dark fruit, cherry.  Medium light sweetness.  Dry finish.  Ave carbonation.  Medium light bodied.  Pretty good.  Not as good as the 12, but pretty good.  Warming alchohol at finish.  Merry Xmas.
Pours cloudy brown. Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, dark sugars   taste is brown sugar, plums, raisins, fig or cherry cant decide   finishes clean   enjoyable beer

Pours dark mahogany with a creamy, dense beige head. Smells of big dark fruits. Taste is of big, rich dark fruits: rum soaked raisins and plums. Full-bodied with slight vinous texture and smooth mouth-carbonation, St. Bernardus Christmas Ale finishes with a slight boozy kick and a touch of warmth.

Pours an average off-white creamy head that mistly diminishes. Body is hazy and copper colored. Aroma contains light bread, flowers, dough, grape, raisin, plum, forest druits ( mostly cherry), red wine or ruby port, cinnamon and other spices. Flavor starts off fresh and fruity, to be followed by sweetness, to finish in light bitterness and warming alcohol. Fruitiness stays all the way. Palate is medium to full, with creamy texture and soft carbonation. A complex, balanced, fresh and warming beer for the long winter nights. Definitely  one to drink again next year.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Color mogano limpido, schiuma di medio spessore marroncina, poco persistente. Sentori di castagna, zucchero caramellato e pan di zenzero; gusto dolciastro con una controparte amarognola nel finale, note di mela cotta, nocciola e malto; al palato è ricca ma non eccessivamente corposa, buona struttura ma un po troppo poco "spessa". Piacevole.

Pours a hazy, nutty brown with a tall, creamy, off-white head. Aroma is vinous, port-like with notes of dried fruit. Quite a full and rich body with lightly sweet, dark malt accents. Touches of yeast and a lot of dried fruit. Never gets overly sweet. Finishes warming but not too boozy. A lovely Xmas treat.

Smells of yeast and fruit (cherries). Pours a dark caramel brown with thick foamy light tan head. Fruit, spice, malt. Full bodied and soft mouth feel.  Slight bitterness and cinnamon finish.  Very nice.
